Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap. This is… really not good. Hold on!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! They’re gaining on us!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I know! I know!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, crank it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, I’m going as fast as I can!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, shit. Keep heading towards the island. I’ll try to hold-- Ah shit. Here they come! They got smaller boats. Ram ‘em!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Got it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, assholes! Tell your bosses to find their own damn treasure! I’m not doing much damage here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just keep them at bay!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ha! You took em out!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Down you go!

Speaker: Sam
Text: There! Uh… big boat. Big boat!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh shit.

Speaker: Sam
Text: God damn it -- they’re dropping mines!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I see ‘em!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just keep heading towards the island, don’t let em get in front of you! Oh shit!
[Nate falls into the sea.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, God damn it. Hey! I’m okay… I’m okay…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Shit, the engine’s out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I can… I can fix it, just… just cover me!

Speaker: Nate
Text: God damn it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon… C’mon…
[Mercenaries attack their boat.]

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Blow them out of the water!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Grenade launcher! Take him out.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: They’re fish in a barrel!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Holy shit.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ha ha. Karma’s a bitch.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Damn it! More coming!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well shit.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, how’s the engine?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Making progress! C’mon… C’mon, go… There! There, I got it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s working?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Head straight to the island. Nathan! Rocks, dead ahead!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I can barely see out there. Shit. Get them off of us!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I‘m doing the best I can here. Nathan, hurry!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just hang on!

Speaker: Sam
Text: On your right! Watch it, watch it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, shit! Aahh!
[They crush into a mercenary boat and roll over.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan!!
[The scene changes dramatically. Young Nate is reprimanded by a nun for a fight.]

Speaker: Nun
Text: Nathan. Nathan… What are we going to do with you? You must be tired of these lectures. I know I’m tired of giving them. Now you have to stay here with me all weekend instead of going on the retreat with everyone else.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t care.

Speaker: Nun
Text: Yes, that is the crux of the problem.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t see why I’m the only one being punished.

Speaker: Nun
Text: Because you started the fight.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He wouldn’t give me back my book.

Speaker: Nun
Text: I told you to leave those books in your room… You only have yourself to blame.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Doesn’t give him the right to just snatch it from me.

Speaker: Nun
Text: Does that give you the right to start throwing punches?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It wasn’t just about the book…

Speaker: Nun
Text: What was it, then?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nothing. I’ll save it for confession.

Speaker: Nun
Text: No matter what I try… you seem insistent on going down the same, sad road as your brother. What a waste.
[The nun leaves. Nate looks out the window and sees Sam on the next roof. He gets out of the window and follows him.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam! I see you. Up and around we go. Whoa! Okay… nice and quiet. Uh oh.

Speaker: Priest
Text: Isn’t it our job to help boys like him?

Speaker: Nun
Text: In the meantime, I’m neglecting the other dozen boys under my care.

Speaker: Priest
Text: What do you want me to him?

Speaker: Nun
Text: You know my opinion.

Speaker: Priest
Text: Well… I’m not ready to give up on him yet.

Speaker: Nun
Text: You can’t keep avoiding it.

Speaker: Priest
Text: Look, I’ll… talk to him in the morning. Okay?

Speaker: Nun
Text: Good night, Father.

Speaker: Priest
Text: Good night, Sister Catherine.
[Sister Catherine comes up to a window to smoke. Nate's waiting for her to go out that window.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Gotta get to that window… C’mon…  Move it, Sister.

Speaker: Priest
Text: Sister Catherine?

Speaker: Nun
Text: Oh, darn…

Speaker: Priest
Text: Ah, Sister Catherine. I’ve forgotten my keys again. Can you open the gate for me?

Speaker: Nun
Text: Coming, Father.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Almost there…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ooh, you gotta learn to watch your back. (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, it’s good to see you, little brother. (sees Nate’s bruise) What? What is that? Really? Again?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s nothing.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You told me you’d stay out of trouble, though.

Speaker: Nate
Text: But he was talking shit about us.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So?

Speaker: Nate
Text: He said that… dad dumped us here cause we’re worthless. And mom is in hell because--

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan. Nathan, c’mon. They’re just saying it because it gets to you. All right? You just gotta learn to laugh it off.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You wouldn’t.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, do as I say, not as I do. Here. You’ll catch a cold.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So… What are you doing here like this anyway? If the nuns catch you, they’re going to call the cops.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, I got something for ya and it couldn’t wait til Christmas.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s outside.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What happened to us staying out of trouble?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, this is an exception.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh-huh… Heh, nice jump. Here, gimme your hand.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Sheesh, you’re light. The Sisters feeding you enough? Place’s kinda empty. Where is everyone?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Some Bible retreat.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeesh. I remember those. How’s Father Duffy doing?

Speaker: Nate
Text: He’s the one decent guy in there. You should come and say hi.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nah… I didn’t need the guilt. This way. That was easy. C’mon.  Damn.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You didn’t prop it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I… I did. At least… I thought I did.  No, it doesn’t matter. We’re gonna take the high road.

Speaker: Nate
Text: The high road?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just follow me. Watch… this.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Sam
Text: And now… we take the high road.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Have you done this before?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah… once or twice. Here, come on. Your turn.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, whatcha been up to?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Working, mostly.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You still dating that girl?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Who… Crystal? Eh… on again, off again. Currently… off again. Okay… No guts, no glory!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa, whoa…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, just don’t think about it. You got this!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I gotcha!  See? No big deal.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Nothing to it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, stay with me. Pretty cool, huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Totally.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Through here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Right behind you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, there’s a jump coming up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay… right down the middle. Nice and easy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aah! Nice and easy.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oops. Was that a sin? I think that’s a sin. You ready, Tarzan? All right, go ahead. It’s a nice view, huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… not bad. You ever been up here before?

Speaker: Sam
Text: This particular roof? No.

Speaker: Nate
Text: But… you do know where you’re going, right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Eh, more or less. You wait here, and you watch me. Whoa… whoa! Whew… Your turn!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay… you got this. You got this, Nate.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, go ahead. Just don’t overthink it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh crap! Ahh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I gotcha! C’mon! C’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I did it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Course you did. Here, follow me. You know what? How about you take this one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Really. I’ll follow your lead.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Attaboy, Nathan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa! Okay.
[They’re leave the territory of the orphanage. Sam shows Nate his motorcycle.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just like that… we’re out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Check it out. Huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. You got the 250?

Speaker: Sam
Text: 250? What are you talking about? No, this is the 500cc, twin.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No way. Where’d you lift it from?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa… That’s a low blow. But hey, I’ll have you know that I am a… changed man, ought this with hard-earned cash. Here, C’mon, take a seat. What?

Speaker: Nate
Text: The only time you pull a stunt like this… is when you’re trying to make up for something.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You are too smart for your own good, you know that? All right. I got this job. Pays well. Really well. But, uh… I gotta leave town for a little bit.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’s a little bit?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Like a… a year. At the most. And then I‘ll be back before you even know it, all right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You’re bailing on me.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah c’mon, don’t be so dramatic.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What, so it wasn’t enough to leave me in that place? How could you do this to me, Sam?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey wait, I’m doing this for you. The money I make is for the both of us. And then in a couple of years, when you’re out…

Speaker: Nate
Text: A couple of years? Take me with you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I-- I can barely support myself.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’ll pitch in.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I know you think the orphanage sucks…

Speaker: Nate
Text: You have no idea.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, but it’s the best thing for you right now. You just gotta trust me on that one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s not fair.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, about our lives has been fair… but we’ve made it work. Right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, you know… the bike wasn’t the only surprise. I guess I’m gonna have to ruin the next one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I found Mom’s stuff. Everything that Dad sold. I tracked down the buyer.

Speaker: Nate
Text: If you’re saying this just to make me feel better…

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, I swear to God.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Eh… on the other side of town. Whaddaya say we go and get it back?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You mean steal it?

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s not stealing if it was ours to begin with.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m pretty sure the cops aren’t gonna see it that way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, then let’s not get caught. You ready for this?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hell yeah.
[The scene changes. Nate takes a punch from some inmate in prison.]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Esto va estar mas fácil de lo que esperaba! (This will be easier than I expected!)  Whoo-

Speaker: Nate
Text: You’re… gonna have to do it better than that, pal.

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Acabemos con esto. (Let’s get this over with.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s go.
[They have a fist fight.]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Chingada, este gringo sabe pelear, eh! (This gringo knows how to fight, eh!) ¡No puedes conmigo! (You can’t beat me!) A ver como te sales de esta! (Let’s see how you get out of this!) ¿¡Qué tal esto?! (How about this?!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah -- asshole, let- go of me!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Agarrenmelo! (Grab him!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Right back at ya!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Lucha como un hombre! (Fight like a man!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right… you asked for it. I got you now.

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Ja! Toma esto, pendejo!  (Ha! Take this, asshole!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Come on! C’mon amigo! (C’mon, "friend!"]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Esto es por meterte con nosotros. (This is for messing with us.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ha!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Ahora si, pendejo… te vas a arrepentir! (Now, asshole… you will regret it!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa, good save.

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Estas muerto! (Die!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ahh shit--!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Te voy a matar, comemierda! ¡Te voy a cerrar la bocota, gringo! (I’m going to fucking kill you! I’m going to close your mouth, gringo!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Get offa me…

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Ya basta. (Stop]

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right -- my turn!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Uh. ¡Ha!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh! What the hell?!
[The warden arrives and stops the fight.]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Ya basta, idiotas! (Stop it, you idiots!]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Suéltenme! (Let me go!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, we weren’t fighting! Huh? Right little guy?

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Te voy a matar, gringo comemierda! (I’m going to fucking kill you!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, give me a call when you’re tall enough to ride the rides!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Te voy a sacar las tripas por el culo!

Speaker: Vargas
Text: (to Nate’s guards) ¡Solitaria! (Solitary cell!)  ¡Céllalo! (Shut up!]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Te voy a estar esperando aqui, eh! (I’ll be waiting for you here!]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: ¡Abre! (Open it.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, come on. How long am I supposed to be in here? Huh? And where’s the toilet?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You’re looking at it. Have fun.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I will. Gracias. (Thanks.]
[Some time passes.]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Get up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh man. I was having a great dream too… Eh… Hey, hey… Easy.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Calmate. (Take it easy.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Es por tu culpa, pendejo. (It’s your fault, asshole.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, ah, any chance I can take a shower?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Céllate. (Shut up.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Morning, boys. Or is it evening? It’s hard to tell down here.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: ¡Oye, idiota! (Hey, idiot!) Get up the stairs! ¡Viene saliendo un prisionero! ¡Abran la reja! (A prisoner is coming out! Open the gate!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey. Nice to see you. Eesh. It’s bright. Ah, and humid.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Welcome to Panama. ¡Atras! ¡Muévanse! ¡Quitense, cabrones! (Back! Move! Get out, you bastards!]

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¿A dónde lo llevas? (Where are you taking him?]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Es una sorpresa. (It’s a surprise.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Diviértete. (Have fun.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: I do speak a little Spanish, you know.  Wait… What did you say?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You’ll find out soon enough.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Te lo adverti, pero no escuchaste. Qué estan mirando? (I warned you, but you did not listen. What are you looking at?]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nada, amigo. Nothing…

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Atras. De este me encargo yo. (Back off. I’ll take care of this one.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Bien. (All right.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where are you taking me, anyway?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You’ll see. No no. Not that way.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. All right…

Speaker: Vargas
Text: After you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. This isn’t sketchy at all. Hey, you know this doesn’t look like the warden’s office.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Go left. Through there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Through here?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Here we are.
[He takes Nate outside the prison.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Okay. Take these cuffs off or what?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: I want in.

Speaker: Nate
Text: In?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Whatever you hope to find up there… I want in.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Now c’mon, Vargas, the deal was just to get us in and out of here, that’s it.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: “Just?” I’m sticking my neck out for you gringos…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah and Rafe is paying you a lot of money for your trouble.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Si. But not nearly enough.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You were told not to open that…

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Yes. I was also told not to take bribes… not to bring anyone here… and not to beat on my inmates. But here we are…

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, but just be careful with that, it’s three hundred years old.
[Vargas read the note aloud.]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: “I was a member of Captain Henry Avery’s crew…” You know who that is?

Speaker: Nate
Text: He was a pirate.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: The pirate who pulled off the biggest heist in history… and got away with it. I looked him up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s great. Can we…?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Over four hundred million dollars worth of gold and jewels. All from one single ship. Uh… the “Gunsway.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Yeah, I’m familiar with the story. Can you get to the point?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Uh, huh huh… “I occupy the highest cell in the Spaniards’ prison…” And here, “I hope someday you will find your way into this infernal place, bear my cross, and discover the riches of paradise.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? What do you want?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: “The riches of paradise.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, chr- It’s a metaphor.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: No, no, no no, no, no. You and your friends did not pay to get into this “infernal place” in search of a metaphor. I want in.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. I’ll tell you what, you let me go up there, check out the prison cell. If there’s still anything there after three hundred years, you can take this up with Rafe. Now c’mon. Letter. Por favor.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: How you gonna get up there, anyways?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Climb. Oh, unless of course you want to do it, since you “want in,” and all.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Just don’t break your neck.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… Well, that’s the plan. Hey, did you bring what I asked?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Yeah. Hid it just over there, under the work table, uh… by the crates.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Great thanks. There we go. Piece of cake. Need my gear.  Bingo. Now we’re in business. Here we go…! Looks like I can slide down there… hook on that post…  Wait till Sam hears about this.  Onward and upward. Well, I gotta find the highest cell. Oh, shit! At least Burnes had a nice view before he was executed… Hard to believe there were dozens of pirates holed up in here just waiting to be hanged. Okay. Where to? Can barely believe the place is still standing. The Spanish sure knew how to build a sturdy prison. Wonder how many pirates die here? All right, not gonna lie.  This is pretty awesome. Whoa, whoa. Ah man, Sam is missing out. Here we go. Burnes’s cell. Cell… More like a suite. Okay, where to begin? Sun and moon… Alchemy symbols for gold and silver. Wait a sec… I saw something like this on the letter. Huh. Well, that’s part of the symbol… Ah. There’s the other half. Now then… That’s more like it. Okay, got a zodiac symbol, Sagittarius, and the Scorpio sign. Ten and two… X and II. Well, would you look at that…
[He solves the puzzle and take some old crucifix. He read its inscription.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Digna Factis Recipimus. Huh… Hm. I guess this is it. Time to head back. C’mon… Whoa! Better watch that first step. Down we go… Hm. Now what? Whoa…! Careful… All right… one more time… Whoa ha ha! Yeah, let’s see Rafe do that.
[Nate leaves a Spanish prison breaking the door.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aggh, there goes my shoulder. There’s Vargas. “I want a cut.” Ha. “I want in.” I’ll give you in. Ah crap, no, no no no. Oof! Made it. Now we’re talking.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You made it. What’d you find? Drake?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Place was picked clean. If there’s a clue hidden up there somewhere, I couldn’t find it.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Are you sure? Were you looking in the right place?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know maybe I just… I missed something in the letter. There could’ve been another tower that collapsed centuries ago.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Mierda… (Shit…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: There ah, any plans to this place? You know, like blueprints?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Ah… could be, there’s a bunch of old files.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, great. Great. Go look through those. Okay, see what you can dig up. Meanwhile, I’ll talk to Sam. He’s our Avery expert. Maybe he can make sense of this whole mess.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Right… I’ll look to the files. Turn around.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…
[Vargas puts Nate in handcuffs again and returns to prison.]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: All right. When you’re done talking to him… come and find me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You got it.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Gringo, if I catch you fighting one more time, one week in the hole for you!

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s some nice acting, Vargas. Almost as good as mine.
[He finds Sam playing dice with prisoners.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Huh--

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Mierda. (Shit.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: ¿Qué puedo decir? Suerte de principiante verdad. (What can I say? Novice’s luck.]

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Hijo de puta. (You motherfucker.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Lo siento, chicos, tengo que irme. (I’m sorry, guys, I have to go.]

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Claro, tgvas cuando estas ganando. (Sure, when you’re winning.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Para ti.   Jesus, they worked you over good. You all right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Eh. Just another day at the office. C’mon.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, whoa, whoa, whoa. You’re not gonna keep me in suspense are you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You were right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, we were right. Now we just gotta find Rafe.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, Rafe…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Don’t, don’t start. Please?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, c’mon. Like you said, we did this. You and me. Now his rich asshole comes in on the tail end--

Speaker: Sam
Text: How long have we been trying to get in here? Hm?-

Speaker: Nate
Text: We had some leads…

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, we didn’t. Okay, not one. So like it or not -- No Rafe. No Vargas. And no getting in here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, speaking of Vargas… we got a problem.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: What kind of problem? Did he let you into the old prison?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, yeah, he did.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: All right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: After he read the letter.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh… Hm… So how much does he know?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Enough that he wants a cut.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, shit… Rafe, if anybody else finds out about this…

Speaker: Rafe
Text: I’ll-- I’ll work it out with Vargas, don’t sweat it. Right now, let’s just… let’s get on to more important matters…

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Let’s find somewhere a little more, uh… private.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Yep.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, coast is clear.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Okay. So, what do we got?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ooh, shit.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh… Hey.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: May I?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just be careful, okay?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Wood with gold and silver inlay. It’s well made. It’s hollow. Why would one of Avery’s men go through the trouble of hiding a cheap crucifix?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s not a crucifix. Technically, a crucifix is a representation of Jesus. It’s not Jesus.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Well, you’re right. No crown of thorns, he’s tied to the cross. Well, if I not Jesus then--?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Read the inscription.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Uh… “Digna factis recipimus.” We receive…

Speaker: Sam
Text: “We receive the due rewards of our deeds.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Look at you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: There’s a benefit of growing up in a Catholic orphanage. It’s Saint Dismas.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, the penitent thief… but what’s the connection?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Guys, let’s just pretend I skipped all of Sunday school…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, okay. During the crucifixion Jesus is placed between two thieves. Okay, one of them mocked Jesus. The other one, this guy… was penitent. He accepted his punishment with grace…

Speaker: Nate
Text: And Jesus brought him to Paradise.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Penitent thief.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You figured it out.

Speaker: Sam
Text: There is a Cathedral of Saint Dismas… in Scotland.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, he last sighting of Avery was in Scotland.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It can’t be a coincidence. (chuckles]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You know, I had my doubt about you. But… Let’s find Vargas. Get the hell out of this shit hole.

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: (whistles]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: I’ll--  Let me guess, this is the guy you picked a fight with?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… Didn’t know he had so many… friends.
[They leave but stumble upon Gustavo.]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Te dije que no habíamos terminado. (I told you we were not finished.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Mira, ya nos ganaste. Okay? (Look, you already beat us. Okay?]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Muy tarde para hablar, de aqui no sales. (Very late to talk, you do not leave here.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, you know what?

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Tú no te metas-- (Do not interrupt--]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay--
[He hits Gustavo in the face. The fight begins.]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Jesus, did you have to pick on the most popular guy in this joint?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, I didn’t hear you volunteer…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Guys! Save it for later!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Ha ha!

Speaker: Nate
Text: ¡Buenas noches! (Goodnight!) ¡Sientate! (Sit down!]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: C’mere, you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Pendejo! (Asshole!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah shit. We’re not done here guys!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Let’s make this quick so we can get out of here!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Bastard!

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Eliminen a estos pendejos! (Kill these assholes!)  Hora de irse, gringo. (Time to go, gringo.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam! Need some help here!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Get off!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Don’t mention it.

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: ¡Estas muerto! (Die!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey! Hey, get off! All right. ¡Espera! (Wait!]

Speaker: Gustavo
Text: Ya basta de hablar. (Enough to talk.]
[Suddenly Vargas appears and beats Gustavo with a baton.]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: ¿Alguien más necesita que les recuerde las reglas?  Alinéense! (Against the wall!]
Action: (Does anyone else need to remember the rules?)

Text: [One of the guards finds Nate’s crucifix.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¿Qué es esto? (What is it?]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: ¡Dame! (Give it to me!) Are you bringing in contraband?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Vargas…

Speaker: Vargas
Text: ¡Callate! (Shut up!) Who do you think you are? Llévalos a su celda! (Take them to his cell!) Me trae a los gringos a mi oficina. (Bring these gringos to my office.]
[In Vargas’s office…]

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Déjanos.  Déjennos! (Leave us NOW!]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Took you long enough. We almost got killed, you know.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You still might.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Vargas-- seriously?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: “Oh, I didn’t find anything, must be in a different tower.” Well?

Speaker: Nate
Text: What can I say, I was raised Catholic. I always carry one.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Funny.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, hey, hey, hey look -- it’s worthless, all right?

Speaker: Vargas
Text: You think I’m an idiot?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Okay. You want to renegotiate? Fine. Stop acting like a third world thug. Now put the gun away. Thank you. We’re willing to give you ah… ten percent.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Think half.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We’re doing most of the work. Twenty. And you’d never find it without us.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Twenty-five. Equals.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Twenty-five… Does that sound fair, guys?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Suppose I can live with that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, sure. Four hundred million divides nicely by four.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Looks like we have a deal.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: Yes, we have a deal.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: All right.

Speaker: Vargas
Text: And if you ever cross me again--
[Rafe swiftly stabs Vargas with a self-made knife and take his gun.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: That’s that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you out of your goddamn mind?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Do you want to find out?

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Abran! (Open the door!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Guys, what are we doing here?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We’re sticking to the plan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Was this part of the plan?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Just follow me.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon. C’mon!

Speaker: Nate
Text: God dammit…
[They start to run.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Rafe, where we, going here?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: The lighthouse. Vargas said the boat is right under the lighthouse.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Ahi estan! (They’re here!) ¡Abre esa puerta! (Open that door!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: But which way?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: I don’t know. We’ll get outside and figure it out. Shit. Dead end.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh… the window. Nathan, gimme a hand.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Hurry up.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Mierda, tiene un arma! (Shit, he has a gun!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: There, it’s open!

Speaker: Sam
Text: We got it!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Then go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t see the lighthouse.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Right now let’s just get away from the guards. Through here.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Don’t stop. Keep going!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Watch yourself.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, crap!

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Los encontre! (I found them!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Over there. To the left!

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Alto! (Halt!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: This way… Ah, no, no, no, no, wait. Over here. C’mon. C’mon.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: They’re surrounding us.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Damn it. It’s locked.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Guys! We can climb this. Shit! Another dead end.

Speaker: Sam
Text: The fire escape! Nathan, get me up there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, Sam. Ready? And…

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Let’s go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, after you.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Over the roof. Follow me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ahhh! Uhhh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Are you sure?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Yes. C’mon, move it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, shit. Seriously? Let’s clean house. All right. We need to catch up with Rafe… quickly. I thought you trusted him.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I do… to a point. There’s a vent here. Help me push.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He‘s going to leave without us, isn’t he?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Not if we’re quick. C’mon. After you.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¿¡A donde mierda se fueron?! (Where the fuck did they go?!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, they’re everywhere.

Speaker: Sam
Text: We’ll be fine, just keep going.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, looks clear.

Speaker: Sam
Text: God damn it, this place is like a maze.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, it’s like they don’t want us to leave or something.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Alto, pendejo! (Stop, assholes!]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Hola, amigo! (Hi friend!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, Rafe. Good to see you. Kick down that ladder for us.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We’re close! There’s the lighthouse. Like I said, stick to the plan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, don’t celebrate yet.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Los perdimos! (We lost them!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s right, just keep searching over there.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Mierda. No pueden estar leios… ¡Pongan mas hombres en las puertas! (Shit. They can not be there… Put more men on the doors!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t mind us.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Disparen a matar! (Shoot to kill!]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: C’mon… and don’t drop the cross.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Vamos! (Let’s go!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right. Keep going’ I’m right behind you!

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Alli! ¡Sobre el techo! (There! On the roof!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, hell…!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: On me! Get to the wall! NOW!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam?!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just keep going. Go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa! I got it… Sam! C’mon! I’ll pull you up! I gotcha! C’mon!
[The guards shoot him with an assault rifle.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: (gasps]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam – no. No, you hold on!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hold on! Gimme your other arm! C’mon, reach! No!
[He falls down, punching the roof with his body.]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We gotta move.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, no, he’s still down there…

Speaker: Rafe
Text: No, he’s gone. C’mon, the boat’s just beyond the wall.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. No, I can’t. I can’t-- I can’t leave him behind.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nate. Your brother is dead. Either come with me or join him.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, he just--

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Have it your way! (runs away]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam… Oh God no, no. Shit. (he runs after Rafe]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Es su ultima oportunidad! Rindanse o mueran! (It’s your last chance! Surrender or die!]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh God. Okay. Okay, gotta get outta here.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Come on!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m coming, I’m coming! I gotta keep going, right?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Whooaaa!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aaaaahhh!
[He jumps from HUGE height into the sea. The name of the Game appears.]

Speaker: UNCHARTED 4
Text: A THIEF’S END

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Made it to the bottom.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Okay… according to your signal you’re at the coordinates -- any sign of our haul?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. Not yet, anyway. You got any pings from up there?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Afraid not.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. I’ll just keep heading downstream.]

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Copy that, keep me posted.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You got it.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Hey. By my watch you’re down to a quarter tank. You wanna come up?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nah, I’ll be fine. It can’t be far.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: If you don’t find it soon, I’m calling it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’ll find it.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… there you are. I found it.
[Nate finds a wreck.]

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right. How’s it look?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s beat up, but intact. All right… here we go. There. Whoa.  Morning, fellas. Well, looks like a lot of it’s still strapped down. See, we got one, two, three… Okay, by my count we’re shy two crates. I’m gonna go round ‘em up.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Hold on, how about you came up first, get a fresh tank?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, the crates gotta be nearby. I got this. Aha! Found one. Agh, crap. The crate’s pinned beneath the trailer.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Tell you what-- secure the other crate first, then we’ll lift the trailer up for ya.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Y’see, that’s why you get paid the big bucks.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Heh. Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aha! Found the other crate.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: One down, one to go. Secure it in the trailer, we’re nearly at your position.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. See you soon. All right, that’s one crate secure.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Good timing. We’re right above you, sling’s on its way down. Coming down… Okay, it’s in position. Hook up the trailer, we’ll raise it up a bit for ya.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, got the cable… Gonna try looping it around one of the axles.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: That should work.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yep. Oh yeah, that’s one…

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right, you watch your oxygen now.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, it’s fine. And that’s two. Okay, trailer’s secure, ready to go.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right. Get clear, we’ll lift it up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ready when you are.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: And up we go… Okay… that enough?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Plenty. Just don’t drop it on me.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: No promises.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay… got the other crate, gonna strap it in with the others. C’mon, C’mon… there you go. Oh boy. All cargo present and accounted for. And with five minutes of oxygen to spare.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Jesus… hey, maybe you should hang out then, see if you can find some other treasures down here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nah, I’m good.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Want a ride up?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’d love one.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Lemme know when you’re on the sling.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, I’m in position. Get me outta here, will ya?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: You got it. Going up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whew.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Mm mm mm, look at that beauty. How you feeling?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Better now that I’m outta that river. I’m gonna stink like fish for a week.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right. We’ve gonna come to you. Hang on.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hanging. What’s up, boys?

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Good to have you back, Drake!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, it’s good to be back.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Toss down your gear.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here you go.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whew.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Whoa. This tank’s kinda light.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m just making your job easier, right?

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: My man… How’d we do?

Speaker: Nate
Text: How do you think?

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Full recovery?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Every last bit.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: You’re making the rest of us look bad.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m making the rest of you look good.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Here, uh… I need your signature on this…

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Okay. Done. Man, I wish they’d move all this to computers.

Speaker: Salvage Worker
Text: Government’s like ten years behind the rest of the world, right?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Let’s wrap this up later. Come on. Let’s go see what you brought us. Hey, so how about you let someone else be PO man next time? You’ve earned a break.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, no thanks. I’ll take a dive over being at the office any day.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Yeah, well uh, either way it’s gonna be a while ‘til the next dive.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What are you talking about? What about Thursday’s job? Oh, come on, no.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Got underbid.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You gotta be kidding me.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Hey, competition’s tough. Let’s see here now… Care to do the honor?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, sure. Thanks. Wow… look at that. We struck copper.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Well, you’d be surprised how much this stuff is worth. Client’s paying good money for the full recover.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure you don’t wanna just melt it down, make some pennies?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: C’mon, let’s go celebrate. First round’s on me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Bar hopping with you guys? No… no, no. Not unless there’s hazard pay. If it’s all the same to you, I think I’m just gonna do the paperwork and get home and crash. Raincheck though?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right, suit yourself. Hey – Good work today.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks.  Copper…
[Next scene.]

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Hey! Hey, Nate! Nate. Hold on.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey. What are you doing here?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Ah… I got a present for ya.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Present? What’s this?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Got some news from my contract about that wreck tiff the coast of Malaysia…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, no…

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Ah… the ship’s intact.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Cargo’s ripe for the packing…

Speaker: Nate
Text: You are a persistent one, I’ll give you that.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: And… all the money came through for the equipment, too. We all set. Except, ah… my best guy-- the guy I trust for the job -- the only one. He… he’s go cold feet.

Speaker: Nate
Text: My feet were never warm to begin with. Tell me, this “contact” of yours… he get the permits?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: No, he did not get the permits. Can’t no one get the damn permits…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Course not.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: But Nate, don’t you see that works in our favor. No permits means no competition. The shit is ours.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No permits means no go.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Nate… this is retirement money. For the both of us. Okay, I don’t know about you, but I don’t want to be working salvage when I’m sixty. Do you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure beats prison. Listen, I have to pass. And trust me so should you.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Okay just take it. Humor me, okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m not gonna change my mind.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Then don’t hurt to sleep on it, does it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Say hi to Karla and the kids for me, okay?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: All right. No pressure, Nate! But think about it!
[Next scene. Nate’s office.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: You really did your homework on this one. Narrowed down the search area. It would make a hell of a find. Son of a bitch.  No. No, no way. You are going with the others.
[He puts the file with the others.]
[Nate gets up from his chair and starts hanging around the attic remembering his adventures… He's picking up a little statue of the cruel goddess Kali…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Climbed your big brother some years back.
[…a handmade skull…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeesh. One of the stranger things I’ve collected along the years.
[…a coin…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: A Spanish doubloon found in a German U-boat… in the middle of a jungle. Who woulda thunk?
[…an old notebook…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sir Francis Drake takes a bullet for Sully.
[…a notebook entitled Shambala with a photo…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Shambala… hmph.  Miss ya, pal.
[…a test tube with green glowing rocks…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: So many men killed each other for a piece of this.
[…a crucifix…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Thanks for nothing, St. Dismas.  Nah…
[…a circle puzzle…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sir Francis and his elaborate puzzles.
[…a belt buckle…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Not really my style any more.
[…a notebook entitled Iram of the Pillars…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Now this was a crazy ride.
[He's pulling a note out of his notebook.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hmm. Another lifetime, Chloe.
[He finds a toy gun.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… Here they come. Take cover! I’m surrounded. Bullseye. Take that! And that. All right. Don’t let ‘em flank you, Nate. Eat plastic! Gotcha. Back in business. Like a pro. Yeah, bring it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey Nate! Are you coming down to eat?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah! Yeah, I’ll be right there. Well, play time’s over.
[He comes down from the attic and walks up to Elena.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Heh. Wow. Now that is a good one. Oh, is this what you’re working on?

Speaker: Elena
Text: You were up there a long time.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, I was researching something.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, is that what we’re calling it these days?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I was.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, would you mind grabbing the food? I’m just… wrapping up here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. Yeah, sure thing.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Nate
Text: There we go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: And… Done. Okay.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Finish it?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. You know, it’s probably too long, and full of typos, but that’s what editors are for, right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Heh.

Speaker: Elena
Text: God, I’m starving.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Looks good.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Mmhmm… So… wa wzz yr dy?

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hm?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Got none of that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, sorry. I’m sorry. How was your day?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. It was fine.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Mmhmm.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Typical day in paradise.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hm.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I, ah… I got to pull a bunch of garbage out of a river.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hmm… At least you got to go for a swim. Did you find any exciting garbage?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, some… brilliant stuff. Brilliant stuff. It was a, um… early twenty-first century truck… we got. Apparently the natives called it a “semi”.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh dear lord…

Speaker: Nate
Text: So… boring stuff. Tell me about the article.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well… it started out as this fluff piece… about tourism in Bangkok, but… I don’t think the magazine is gonna like the angle that I’m taking because… Everyone… immediately commented about how rude the smog was… that it was like shock to the lungs, like, the second that you got off the plane.
[Nate stop listening and watch a picture of a beach in a jungle.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah--! What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Where are you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m here… being stabbed with a fork.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, really?

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? Just keep going! It was – it was interesting.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Interesting. What’s my article about?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wha--this one?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Mm-hmm.

Speaker: Option 1
Text: Flights in Bangkok….

Speaker: Option 2
Text: People… of Bangkok …? (you pick that one]

Speaker: Option 3
Text: The lost city of Bangkok…?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… the people of… of… ah, Bangkok. And-- and the smog. And how they – they can’t get a flight anywhere. And… people can’t breathe.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wow…

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, I’m sorry.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No, it was valiant. That was really--

Speaker: Nate
Text: I was in the ballpark, right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: In a different state. But, yeah, you were in a ballpark.

Speaker: Nate
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Jameson asked you about that Malaysia job again.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jameson always asks me about the Malaysia job.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Look, Nate… I really think that you should take it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know what, I don’t want it. Really. I mean, he doesn’t have the permits. And we agreed, we’re not gonna take that kind of work anymore. It’s just not worth it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, but… it… it doesn’t sound that risky. All right? If it’s just the permits--

Speaker: Nate
Text: No way.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You could call Sullivan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: (sighs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: You haven’t seen him in what, two years?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Elena. Look, could we please drop this?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, I just don’t want you to not take it because of me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m not taking it because of me, okay? I appreciate the gesture. It’s just… (sighs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’m gonna go ahead and do the dishes.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Stop, I’ll do them. No, hold on.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You did them last night…

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, you cooked. I clean. It’s fine. I mean… at least -- at least, uh, let m -- let me try to earn it or something. Let me, uh… play you for it.

Speaker: Elma
Text: You’ll “play me for it?”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, your little TV game thing. I bet I can beat your high score.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You think that you can beat my high score on my “TV game thing?”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I think yo scared now.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You don’t even know what it’s called. (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t need to know what it’s called. I’ve seen you play. It’s jumping and running and I have a natural talent for that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, really? Right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So what do you say, chicken? Is it a bet? (chicken clucking noises]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh wow. Okay, cowboy.
[And… they play PS1. Crash Bandicoot.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Watch and learn.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, I’m learning all right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Is this it?

Speaker: Elena
Text: No. It has to load.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Load?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Nate
Text: This is taking a really long time.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You have no patience.

Speaker: Nate
Text: When you turn something on, you expect it to-- Okay, here we go. “Crash Bandicoot.”

Speaker: Elena
Text: Is there a problem?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. No, just ah… How do you, ah… How do you make it go?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Push the START button.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I knew that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: All right. Okay… so you want to run towards the camera.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Run to the camera. Got it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: And the Circle button is your spin attack.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Spin attack!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, run away from the boulder!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Why is the boulder chasing me?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just run away from it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I did nothing to this boulder.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Use your spin attack! Wait, jump. Jump!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Stop yelling at me.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’m encouraging you, I’m coaching you. Keep going, keep going.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What is that thing, a fox?

Speaker: Elena
Text: A bandicoot.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Looks like a fox. It’s like a fox in jeans.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, smash the boxes.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Why is a fox smashing crates?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Bandicoot… and that’s just -- It’s what he does.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s a fox and It s not very realistic. Huh, these graphics are pretty good. Aren’t they? Perfect. By the way, foxes can’t do this.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s a bandicoot.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That doesn’t look anything like a bandicoot.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Have you ever seen a bandicoot?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh-- no, but I’m sure they don’t wear sneakers.

Speaker: Elena
Text: That was-- that wasn’t… hmmm… not too bad. Is that it? You asked for it…

Speaker: Nate
Text: You gotta be kidding me. I practically had it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You can give it another shot. C’mon, double or nothing. My car could really use a good cleaning.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really? Really, you’re gonna start the smack talk now?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. There’s this mode called “easy” mode. I just switch it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s way easier on “easy” mode.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know-- you know, just keep talking… Keep talking…

Speaker: Elena
Text: What are you gonna do?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m-- I’m warning you…

Speaker: Elena
Text: What are you gonna do?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m warning you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: In real life, what can you do? Show me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey. I’m telling you--

Speaker: Elena
Text: What can you do in real life?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m telling you. What do you think about that, huh?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, are you happy?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, of course. You?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Um…

Speaker: Nate
Text: “Um?” Really?

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mere.
[And then they have some sexy time. On the next day…]

Speaker: Nate
Text: We’re not open yet! We’re closed! C’mon, man. All right, I’m coming, I’m coming! Asshole. Yeah. Can I help you?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, I’m uh… lookin’ for my little brother. He’s about your height… little bit leaner… definitely less gray in the temples.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam…?

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s good to see you again, Nathan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh my God, Sam!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa! All right, all right. Take it easy, take it easy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: How…? I thought you-- I saw you get shot.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yes, you did. Right… there…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Sam
Text: The doctors they-- “doctors”-- they patched me up… and they tossed me right back into the cell.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, but I… I made calls, I checked everywhere. Everything I heard, everything I found… it all confirmed you were dead.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, we killed a guard. They wanted to see me rot in that cell for the rest of my life… and I nearly did.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus, Sam, I… If I’d have known, I swear to you I would’ve come af--

Speaker: Sam
Text: You would’ve come back. I know, Nathan. I know. What’s important now though is that I’m out. Hey, hey! You still with me?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. I need some air.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You’re not gonna pass out on me or nothin’, are you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I… I just might. It’s a lot to digest y’know? How’d… how did you get out? When did you get out? How’d you even get here? Find me?

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, all right. Slow down. Okay? Have a seat. I want to hear about you, huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Me?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’s to tell?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well… I called some of the old contacts… they tell me some pretty crazy-ass stories…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus… what crazy stories?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Gut-shot, hanging from a derailed train in the Himalayas?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. That ah… That actually happened.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon, man, what did I miss?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus, Sam, where do I start?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Start with the best part.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, um… Do you remember the theory that we had that Sir Francis Drake faked his own death?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, sure.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay… He did. I found the coffin.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Off the coast of Panama?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. And get this -- okay, I open it up, right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: And there’s no body, but-- But… at the bottom… is his old journal.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You shittin’ me?
[They talking for couple of hours. Nate tells Sam what’s happened in the Uncharted trilogy.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: I mean what can I say? Another lost city destroyed, and uh… we made it out alive… barely.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Unbelievable.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Yeah it was. I wish you could’ve been there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, it’s literally unbelievable. You tell me you stumble upon yet another archaeological gold mine… and somehow you managed to walk away… with nothing.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well, it’s the story of my life I guess. But y’know, I managed to grab a few trinkets here and there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hmm…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Paid off the car, the house, engagement ring… Engagement ring. I’m married. I can’t believe-- Elena, from the stories? That’s my wife. You gotta come meet her. Tonight, dinner. At my place. You’re coming to dinner; I can tell her all about you. Shit, I gotta tell her all about you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan… I’m in a lot of trouble here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? What are you talking about? I kind of trouble?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Does the name Hector Alcazar ring a bell with you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, he’s the drug lord.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Mm-hmm.

Speaker: Nate
Text: “Butcher of Panama,” right? Why?

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s a funny story, but um… for the last year he was my cell mate. So this is how I got out of prison…
[Sam tells Nate his story…]

Speaker: Sam
Text: What, you’re not reading tonight?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Samuel, come here. Listen. The guards. They’re singing.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Eh, well, they’re probably drunk.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Perhaps. But they’re content. How can they be content with their small lives… their miserable jobs?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, I mean, they have lives to go home to. What do we got? Hmm? No offense.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: We have ambition.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: And when we get out of here… that ambition will take us to places these idiots cannot even imagine.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, well, amen to your optimism.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: What will you do when you get out, Samuel?

Speaker: Sam
Text: That’s if I get outta here. I’m sure you can imagine.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: I can. But I want to hear you say it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I will find the greatest pirate treasure of all time… which I am sure you are sick of hearing about by now.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Oh, no… The tale of Henry Avery and his four hundred million in jewel and gold has… become a sweet lullaby for me. Do you really think you can find it?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Given the opportunity? Absolutely.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Ambition… What is that Avery quote?

Speaker: Sam
Text: “I am a man of fortune, and I must seek my fortune.”

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Hm… I like how he thinks.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What the hell was that?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: The opportunity of a lifetime.

Speaker: Henchman
Text: Senior Alcazar. Un gusto verlo. (A pleasure to see you.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Saquenme de aqui. (Get me out of here.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa…

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¿Qué hacemos con él? (What do we do with him?]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Samuel. Are you ready to seek your fortune?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: ¡Vámonos! (Let’s move on!]
[Sam escapes the prison with Hector.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Holy shit.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: ¿Los demas, estan en posicion? (The others, are they in position?]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: En camino. Todo ya de acuerdo al plan, senor. (On the way. Everything is according to the plan, sir.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Fantástico. (Fantastic.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: How long have you had this planned?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Since the moment I set foot in this place. Samuel. Keep up. We’re going to have to move quickly.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Holy shit.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Pedazo de mierda. Nunca saldras de aqui vivo. (Piece of shit. You will never get out of here alive.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Ocupate de la puerta. Silencio. (Take care of the door. Quietly.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: These men are sadistic. We’re doing the world a favor, huh? Here.  You’ll need this. You remember how to use it?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, it’ll come back to me.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Abran todas las puertas. (Open all the doors.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hector. You do that and you’ll start a goddamn riot.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Exactly. Haganlo.  Stay close, Samuel. Ponganse listos. (Get ready.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Oh, mierda! (Oh, shit!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Stick to me. Move it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: This is crazy.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: , We’re going to need to earn our freedom. ¡Sigan al frente! (Go ahead!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Here we go.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Let’s go. Samuel, take cover! ¡Déjennos pasar… y los deiamos vivos! (Let us pass… and we leave them alive!]

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Pudrete, Alcazar! (Fuck you, Alcazar!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Let him go, damn it!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Thanks!

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: You see? The plan’s working.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, I see. So now what?

Speaker: Henchman
Text: Estamos en posicion, estan listos? (We are in position, are you ready?]

Speaker: Radio
Text: Si. Busquen donde cubrirse. (Yes. Find where to cover yourself.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Samuel. Get behind something.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What? Why?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Just do it! Samuel. Get behind cover!  I told you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Holy shit.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: You all right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, my ah… my ears are ringing but… but I’ll live.

Speaker: Henchman
Text: Senor Alcazar? (Mr. Alcazar?]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Estamos bien. (We are fine.]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: Entendido. Siganme. Las camionetas estan en camino. (Understood. Follow me. The van is on the way.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Muy bien. (Very well.]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¡Cuidado! ¿Y este gringo? ¡Tenemos que salir de aqui! (Watch out! And this gringo? We have to get out of here!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: El gringo esta conmigo. Manténganlo vivo. (The gringo is with me. Keep him alive.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: God damn it…!

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Samuel! Run!

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Te tengo, gringo! (I have you, gringo!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Get back, son of a bitch! C’mon. Up the stairs.

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¡Te cubrimos! (We cover you!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s go time.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Ahí arriba! (Up there!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: ¡Liquidarlos! (Kill them!]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: Casi estámos… (We are almost…]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: We’re almost there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah… almost…

Speaker: Henchman
Text: El area esta asegurada. (The area is secured.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Estamos bien.  Samuel! Come on. Samuel, take cover! Samuel. In a minute, we will either be free or dead. Are you ready?

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Deténganlos!(Stop them!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh shit!

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: They’re on us!

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡No los dejen escapar! ¡Matenlos! (Do not let them escape! Kill them!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Let’s do this.

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¿Listos para irnos? (Ready to go?]

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Salgamos de aquí! (Let’s get out of here!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Samuel, stay back!  ¡Bien hecho! (Well done!) ¡Cuiden al gringo! iNo quiero que le pase nada! (Take care of the gringo! I do not want anything to happen to him!]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¡La torreta! ¡Cuidado con la torreta! (The turret! Beware of the turret!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Shit! What the hell do we do now?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Keep moving up!

Speaker: Sam
Text: We’re not going to make it!

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Keep shooting!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Shit. I’m pinned down!

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Just hold on! Patience, Samuel.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa! My God…

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: You see? No time to catch your breath… move it!

Speaker: Hehchman
Text: Las camionetas están en camino. (The van are on the way.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: No se paren. No nos pueden detener! (Do not stop. They can not stop us!]

Speaker: Henchman
Text: ¡Atras! (Behind!]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Go! Don’t bother with them. Keep running.

Speaker: Guard
Text: ¡Deténganlos! (Stop them!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: They’re everywhere! Okay. Oh, shit!
[They get in the van and drive off.]

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Agua.  Here. Samuel, drink.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, no, no, I’m good. I’m better than good actually.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Here. You’re dehydrated. Go on, drink.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Thank you.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: So… What’s next for Samuel Drake, huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Jesus, what is next… uh… I’m gonna take a bath. Gonna sleep in a real bed.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Maybe find a nice warm body to sleep next to me. Uh… track my brother down. That seems like a pretty good start.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Yeah… It is. So… How long do you think it will take you to retrieve Avery’s treasure?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh… I don’t know, I mean, I get back to the States, I can resume my search.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: How long?

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s kinda hard to say until I get started.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: You said you know where it is.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, I do, but-- Listen, it’s not like Avery left some map with a big red X on it, okay? …but I’ve, I’ve got some very solid leads.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: ¡Deténgase aqui! (Stop here!]
[The van stops. Sam is pulled out of him and put a gun to his head.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, okay. Just-- Just-- Wait a minute! Ta-- Hey! Take it easy.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: I like you, Samuel. More importantly, I believed you. That is why you are here.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I-- I can get it, okay? I just need some time.

Speaker: Alcazai
Text: Dame un cuchillo.  You see the problem is…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh God…

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: I’m having all these doubts enter my mind.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hector, listen to me. I will find it. I swear it. Six months.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: People are lazy. They always ask for more time than they actually need. Three months.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Three months is impossible.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Three months. Half the treasure. Can you do it? Say it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Three months. Half the treasure.

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Now… If you run, or try to hide the treasure or do something really stupid like go to the authorities… I’ll know. And when you least expect it, I will be there. At that point… death is not a mercy I will grant you. Here C’mon, the nearest town is ten kilometers in that direction, towards the sunrise. Been while since we’ve seen a sunrise outside, huh? ¡Vamos! (Let’s go!]

Speaker: Sam
Text: When I find it… then what?

Speaker: Alcazar
Text: Don’t worry. When the time comes… I’ll be there to collect. Buena suerte, Samuel. (Good luck, Samuel.]
[We’re back to Nate and Sam talking.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: So, Alcazar lets me go, and… here we are.

Speaker: Nate
Text: This is bad.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, we just pick up the trail where we left off and--

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, trail? Sam, there’s no trail. After Rafe and I escaped, he took his parents’ fortune and bought up all the land around the Saint Dismas cathedral. We combed that place for weeks. Avery’s treasure isn’t there. Not that that’s stopped Rafe. Moron’s been digging for years. Still hasn’t turned up squat.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Not really surprised.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What does that mean?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well I just, you know, happened to do a little digging of my own… And uh… Bet you Rafe doesn’t have this. It’s really amazing what you can find on the internet these days.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s just the Saint Dismas cross.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, is it? Because the one we found was broken and hollow, remember?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Holy crap, it’s still intact. Avery made more than one cross.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So whatever’s missing from one in Panama…

Speaker: Nate
Text: …is probably still inside this one. Well, all right. Where is this?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, this exquisite is going up for auction in three days at the Rossi Estate.

Speaker: Nate
Text: The Rossi Estate.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, you know it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh, yeah. How do you plan on securing an invite to an exclusive, heavily guarded black market auction?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, you don’t necessarily need an invitation, per se.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, and where are you gonna get the money to outbid all the high rollers? I could take a second mortgage out on my house and it still wouldn’t be enough to… Yeah, you’re gonna try and steal it, huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: No. We are.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh no. No, man, listen, I can’t. I’m out.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, I just don’t do that kind f thing anymore. Besides, there are plenty of other guys that are much more equipped to handle this kind of thing.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Like who?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Um. I don’t know, like uh…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Anybody-- Charlie Cutter?

Speaker: Sam
Text: No.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, he’s my go-to guy for this sort of things.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, no, no, absolutely not. I don’t trust Charlie or anybody else you got on that phone with my life. Okay? I need you on this one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh man. Sam, there’s gotta be another way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Not with the time I’ve got left. And certainly not with Alcazar.
[Nate calls Elena.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, hon, it’s me. Yeah, listen, you’re not gonna believe this. Jameson just walked in here with the permits. Yeah. I know, I know. But uh… Looks like I’m going to take the Malaysia job after all.
[In the next scene, Nate and Sam are already sitting near the mansion and watching with binoculars.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: See anything yet?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just a bunch of high class, low-life criminals, all cleaned up for prom. And no sign from Sullivan yet.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, there’s still plenty of time. Looks like the storage room is in the building behind the manor. Looks like the storage rooms in the building behind the manor. You see it from up there?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just the very top of it. Ooh, I wonder what they got tucked away in there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s just focus on Avery’s cross, okay?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I don’t know. You sure you don’t wanna pick up something for the wife?

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s cute. Just keep it simple.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right. Simple. It’d be a whole lot simpler if it was just the two of us.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam…

Speaker: Sam
Text: We could be inside already.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Not cleanly.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Have you even thought about a backup plan in case Sullivan gets cold feet?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, because he won’t.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Or if he got caught?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam.… he knows the people running the auction. He’s gonna schmooze is way right through that party, get upstairs, unlock the window, and we’re in. It’s a solid plan.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh-huh.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, fine. Go ahead. Say it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What if he stole the cross for himself?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Not in a million years.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Victor Sullivan. The same Victor we’re talking about, right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yes, he’s double-crossed people in the past. But not us.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No. Not you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know you two have never seen eye to eye.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Huge understatement.

Speaker: Nate
Text: But I trust him, all right? He’s family. No, no, no, look-- I just need you to trust him too.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Fine, fine.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He’ll come through for us. Eventually.

Speaker: Sam
Text: But, I mean, come on, you have to at least just for one second consider the possibility--
[He notices a signal from Victor.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: There! See? Trust. Hey--

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just try to keep your tux clean.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks.
[Our thieves go to the mansion…]

Speaker: Sam
Text: I can’t believe I’m out. Can’t believe I’m here… with you… in Italy, huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, me either… just wish the circumstances were less tense. You know?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, well…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, the sights are a bit more enjoyable at way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh… uh… so this-- this isn’t your first time here?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, it’s more like… third? Had a couple of odd jobs.

Speaker: Sam
Text: With Sullivan?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well… yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay. There’s no way up onto that bridge.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, there’s that exposed beam underneath.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, you think you can rope it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Do I think I can rope it? Hmmph. Watch this.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m watching.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I, uh… I missed…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, you see, it’s… ah, it’s all in the wrists. Here, let me see it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ha. See?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, it’ ‘hot bad… for a second attempt.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You see that?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, like a pro!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Your turn!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey… bet we can swing off that beam up there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Definitely. Here, let’s switch places. All right, climb over me, I’ve-- I’ve got a good grip.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay, here we go…  First try.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. No one likes a show off.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay. C’mon, Nathan. Looks like you can climb down and make your way over.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Right behind you. Okay…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Shhh shh. Hold up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, we’re good.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Jesus. Did you see him? That rent-a-thug packing some serious heat. Shoulda brought guns.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, we’re gonna pull this off so smoothly, we won’t need ‘em.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I hope you re right.  All those years… it’s the little things that you miss the most.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Like what?

Speaker: Sam
Text: The smell of fresh citrus. Ah, riding a motorcycle. It’s little things, but… they add up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That should hold. All right, come on down.

Speaker: Sam
Text: These landings are a little more pain than I remember.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, tell me about it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So, uh… your other wonderful finds… the ones I missed. You at least take any pictures?

Speaker: Nate
Text: This looks promising.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I think you mean “precarious.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, shit!

Speaker: Sam
Text: You okay up there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… yeah, I’m good. It’d suck if you missed right now.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It sure would. But I don’t miss.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All, right, thanks.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah… Nathan…? Nathan?

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay…

Speaker: Nate
Text: You all right? How do I look? Like four hundred million bucks. Let’s go.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right. I’m right behind ya.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sully?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Know what I love about partying with a bunch of crooks?

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’s that?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nobody cares if you smoke indoors.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s been a while.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Too long, boyo.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You remember my dead brother, right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Victor.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’ll be goddamned. Fifteen years…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yep.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Good to see you alive, Sam.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s uh… try keeping him alive by getting this cross, huh?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah, uh, about that…

Speaker: Sam
Text: What? What about that?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: C’mon, lemme show you something. Take a look.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s Avery’s cross.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: They brought it out of storage just before you guys got here.

Speaker: Sam
Text: They changed the lot order.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Take a whole pile of cash to make that happen.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, well how long before they start the bidding?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Ten, fifteen minutes tops.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, there’s gotta be some way we can grab it.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: There is just the small matter of a few hundred eyewitnesses down there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, okay… but we just need a diversion.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Like?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Like, um… Like I don’t know… but there’s gotta be something.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, if the guards see us making for that cross--

Speaker: Sam
Text: What if they don’t see us? Jesus, you guys act like you’ve never spent time in prison. If you want something dirty done… then you wait…

Speaker: Nate
Text: For lights out.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: For lights out.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Where’s that electrical panel for this place?

Speaker: Nate
Text: There’s ventilation… electrical… That’s it up here. So we just have to climb up there and kill the lights…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Grab the cross in the dark.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: There will be an emergency generator.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’ll give us a few seconds of darkness to work with.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Meaning… we’ll have to be right next to the cross when the lights go out.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Except there’s no way we can get that close without being noticed.

Speaker: Waitress
Text: Scusate, signori… (Sorry, gentlemen…) Antipasti? (Appetizers?]

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m all set.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hi. How are you?

Speaker: Waitress
Text: Ciao. (Bye.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Would you focus?

Speaker: Sam
Text: A waiter wouldn’t get noticed.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: That could work.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh-huh.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That will work. All right, I’ll get to the breaker room, kill the power.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You mean I’m the waiter?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You’re the best pickpocket. You head down to the floor, keep an eye on the prize, okay? Let us know if anything, uh… hinky… goes down.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Roger that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: .All right. Listen, we’ve still got this. Ready?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ready.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: All right, follow me. We’ll cut through the cellar.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I gotta say, Victor. The years have been kind to you.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Thanks. I chalk it up to going vegan.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Really?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Mi dispiace. (I’m sorry.]

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Are you kidding me? Hell, no. Cellar’s just through there. Let’s go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, this place is fancy… Of course they’d play douchey European techno.
[They find the cellar.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, hell… it’s locked…

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Shit, it was open earlier.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, no what? Can we pick it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, it electronic.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: We’re gonna have to find another way in--

Speaker: Sam
Text: You see that?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Keycard… back left pocket.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yup.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m on it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, whoa, whoa. You sure you wanna do that? There’s a lot of eyes out here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I think I can handle a simple lift.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, real smooth.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m not even trying yet.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, I can tell.

Speaker: Nate
Text: And he doubted me.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: A pleasure to watch professionals at work.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: All right… let’s try this again. We’ll still need these.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Great.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Good luck.

Speaker: Nate
Text: We’ll be in touch.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Hands in the air. Hi, Victor.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hello, Nadine. Pleasure to see you again.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Only this time, I’ve got the drop on you.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, I guess I should be glad that’s not a real gun. Hardly recognize yo outta your fatigues.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Yeah… You know how it is. Every once in a while a job requires us to get all… dolled up. Looking sharp, by the way.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Not too bad yourself.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Feel so out of place here. Can’t tell you what a relief it is to run into another English speaker… even if you are American.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You’ll have to blame my parents for that one.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I was on my way to the bar. Can I get you something?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah, scotch -- on the rocks.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Be right back.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nate. You catch all that?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yes, I did… sounds like a lady’s trying to buy you a drink.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah. Nadine Ross is buying me a drink.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nadine Ross…? Wait, doesn’t she own that army-for-hire? What’s it called, Coastline?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Shoreline.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Right. Thought you had a run-in with them?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: That’s putting it mildly. Fortunately, she does not seem to be holding a grudge.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m good to go here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Listen, we’re all set, Sully. You, uh… stay out of trouble, okay?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’ll try.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You ready?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Let’s do it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Gotta find where the waiters and caterers are hanging out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Lure one out of the kitchen, probably.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Then let’s go find the kitchen.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Man, there’s enough food down here to feed a small town. Crap…

Speaker: Sam
Text: You see a waiter in there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No… just more heavily armed goons.

Speaker: Sam
Text: The hell is this? This gate wasn’t on the blueprint. Locked, of course. Okay, Plan B… There you go. See some vents up there… Nathan, come check this out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here we go. Let there be light…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Bad electrical in this joint.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t suppose you brought a fl-- Yeah, that’ll do. I guess it’s always a good idea to bring a smoker along. Unless you need to run.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oof, man… I’m starting to get a little drunk off the fumes in here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Good thing Sully’s driving. Maybe the vent access is behind these casks…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Good job. That’s a lot of really rare vintage.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, maybe Alcazar can just settle for some good wine.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, uh… should we worry that Victor is chatting up Nadine Ross? I mean, I’ve heard some chatting up Nadine Ross? I mean, I‘ve heard some pretty scary stories about her crew…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t worry about Sully. Guy can talk his way out of anything. This way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey… look, the vents. That’s our way out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I got it. No need to give me a hand or anything.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m holding the lighter.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Holding the lighter… Okay, up we go. All right, there. Vent’s smaller than it looked, huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: And a lot more dusty.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Shh, shh, Shh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Damn it… waiters. And baldy looks like my size, too.

Speaker: Nate
