Text: I noticed. Good sense of humor, though.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What have we here?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Did ya film something down there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Maybe. Do me a favor, get behind the wheel for a sec?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Will do.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey Sully! Throw the car in reverse.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay, give me a second.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Damn. These pirates weren’t messing around. Okay…. What do we have here?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: So?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nothing major, I’ll show ya back at the hotel. Sully, what were you talking about?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Uh… Yeah, so… If you don’t mind me asking, how’d you pass the time in prison?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, y’know, reading, mostly. There was this one guard, saw me as a charity case, I guess. He’d check out books from the library for me.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: So what’d you read.

Speaker: Sam
Text: History, especially everything related to Avery and other pirates… just in case, you know.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Sure.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You know, besides books…

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Ah, hell. See that smoke?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa, whoa, Shoreline. Slow down.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sorry. You were saying?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Um… oh, right. You know, besides books… push-ups… smoking… trying to stay out of fights between rival gangs… Just a whole lot of thinking. That’s pretty much it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, if you had a guard doing you favors, why didn’t you use him to at word to us?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, I tried. I asked him to mail a letter – to your P.O. box.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I never got it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: That would be because th warden saw it. I got busted up pretty bad and never saw that guard again.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I got my own back when the warden decided to room me with Alcazar. That didn’t turn out how he expected.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You know, come to think of it… I actually dealt with Alcazar a few decades ago, even before I met you two.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No shit? How are you still alive?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well he wasn’t quite the man he is today. Still working his way up the criminal ladder then. I sold his boss a few woodcut prints I’d smuggled out of Japan. He was into shoguns and such. Alcazar was the go-between.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What was he like?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Soft spoken, but intense. Like he could explode at the slightest provocation.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, he hasn’t hanged much then has he?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I got my money and got the hell out of there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So… pirate walks into a bar…

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh great. Here we go.

Speaker: Sam
Text: And he’s got this steering wheel sticking out of his crotch.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: All right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So the bartender goes, “hey man, what’s with the wheel?” And the pirate says back, “Arrrr! It’s drivin’ me nuts!”  Ahhhh I love that one.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Don’t make me leave you out here.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Looks like Shoreline found something. Go slow.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You got it.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: This thing come with airbags? Or parachutes?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Check it out, boys…

Speaker: Sam
Text: That is it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Cool.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Holy shit. You can probably see all of King’s Bay from up here.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah. Hey look, there’s the city…

Speaker: Sam
Text: And there’s the river valley…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey guys, there’s another tower just over the hill.

Speaker: Sillivan
Text: See any Shoreline mercs?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I can’t tell.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, wouldja look at this.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Quite the view.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I just keep waiting to wake up, and find myself in solitary or something. It’s all some kind of dream.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, no, no guilt grip. I’m just… let’s go find this thing.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You bet.  So, how’re you doin’?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Eh, still in one piece.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I appreciate you coming along for the ride. And especially for negotiating with that rental guy.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: No problem. Hell, I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t enjoying myself.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Me too.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, it would appear we got here first.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Let’s check the place out and keep moving. Whaddya make of the drawbridge, Nathan?

Speaker: Nate
Text: A little out of place. But you don’t put up a drawbridge unless you’re trying to hide something…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Such as… pirate treasure?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Maybe… Huh… Shoreline must’ve been here before. Finders keepers.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m gonna go check out that drawbridge.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sounds good.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, be careful, kid.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey Nathan, the stairs are busted. There’s no way up to the drawbridge crank.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, I’ll see if there’s something up here! Whoa! Hey guys, there’s a massive tower just past the drawbridge. Biggest one yet.  Sam! Special delivery!  Whhooaaa! Whoa, whoa, whoa!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey kid, you all right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: You all right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You go, this?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Mm-hmm.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, see you in a few.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’ll bring tie car closer!

Speaker: Nate
Text: You two just relax, I got this.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I mean, there’s only one crank, ow?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Keep up the good work, kid. Stop, stop! Shoreline coming!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! Shoreline!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, no. Guys! Hide! Ah, these clowns are really getting on my nerves.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Rental car-- must be theirs.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Form a grid! I want him found. No warning shots. You see them, you take them down.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: Come out, come out! I promise to make it quick for ya.

Speaker: Mercenary 2

Text: As tempting as that sounds, Rafe… I gotta say, I’m… not normally the kind of guy who likes to quit while he’s ahead.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Rafe
Text: Okay. “Pro Deus quod licentia.” For God and liberty. These are nice pictures, Nate. Good composition.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: You hacked our phones.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Rafe
Text: You stole my cross! Listen, Nate… if you’re half as smart as you think you are… you’ll accept my offer. What’s it gonna be.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Listen, as nice as it’s been to catch up with you, I… really got to take this call so…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Rafe
Text: Well, Nate, one more thing-- Nate!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Rafe
Text: You, uh… you do realize that your phones are equipped with GPS, right? I’ll see you soon, buddy.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Shit.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Let me guess. Goons with guns on their way here now?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: “For God and liberty.” Nathan, do you understand what this means?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, listen to me. Get off the streets right now. And destroy your phone.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: What’s going on?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Rafe knows where we are! All right, you gotta find some place to hide.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh shit!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam? Sam!  Damn it.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey…!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I’ll buy you a new one.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sully… Think that’s Sam’s tower.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: That’s definitely Sam’s tower. Come on. This way.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Eh… Pardon me.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Excuse me. Excusez-moi  How long you think before Rafe gets here?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Let’s not stick around to find out.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sorry, pal.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Come on. Down here, Nate! Nate, watch out! Everyone out of the way! Good work. Down! Whoa! You know, I’m not 100% sure, but, I think they found us! That one didn’t work, Nate! Jesus Christ! Nate, get out of there! Nice one! Up the stairs!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: So, having fun yet?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh, a real blast!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, you son of a.…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Bastard!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: You good?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Great. Floor it!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, how do we get to Sam?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: We just keep heading downhill.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Brilliant.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nate, more of ‘em!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, shit! Hang on!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh, Christ!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Get outfit the way!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Whoah, whoah, whoah, careful! Jesus! Damn it! It’s that goddamn truck again!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, crap! Look out!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Please don’t run anyone over!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sorry!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Sam’s tower is at the bottom of this hill, keep going down! God damn it! We gotta shake that truck!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Working on it!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, that was clean laundry!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: They can wash it again!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Where the hell are you going?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: You’re the um i “just head down!”

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Jesus!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Coming through!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh this was really a great idea, Nate!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Do you wanna drive?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: No, you’re doing just me.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: See? I got it. Ah, crap! These guys ‘don’t give up! Okay… Through here…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Whoa whoa, whoa, stop, stop, STOP!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Damn stick shift.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Come on, come on, get outta here!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Go!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh… I’m just gonna… Cut through here! What am I supposed to do now?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, up those stairs!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Here we go!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Whoooaaahhh!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Man, Rafe really wants us out of the picture!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Gee, ya think.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah!  I think we lost ‘em!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey Nate?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: We can never, ever come back to this city.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Add it to the list.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Ha! Whoa whoa whoa! Watch it!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Really?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well you’ve got a 4x4, go around.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hang on!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Sorry fellas. First time driver here. Yeah, we’ll be out of your way in a second.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: All right… Let’s see that truck get past that. Oh, come on!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Cut right! Cut right! Wait, wait!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t worry, I got this. I got this. I got this! I don’t got this!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Holy shit!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: We’re close! Keep an eye out for Sam!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey! I think that’s him. Right there!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hold on!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Whaddya think I’ve been doing?!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: How do we get to him?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Damned if I know. Just keep following that convoy. Man! You think they’ve sent enough goons after us?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, we’re still alive, so maybe not.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: There they are!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: You see any way to get to Sam?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Not yet, but we’re running out of road, kid!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I know, I know!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Uh, Nate! Nate!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Here! Take the wheel!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: What? Are you out of your goddamn mind?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yep, probably! Coming through! Ow! God!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Mercenary
Text: He’s dragging behind us!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you shitting me?  Ah, Christ! Move it! Oh, shit-- !

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hi there. Get out!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, brother! Whoa!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Get closer!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m trying! Okay! Okay! Hop on!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hop on! Sam, get in the goddamn car!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m faster! Stop arguing!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Watch out! I gotta get out of here.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Mercenary
Text: No slimmin’ way he could have survived that. Why chance it?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Damn it. That’s not good.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Holy shit, he’s still alive!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, crap. C’mon… Hop on! Gun it!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Here! Take this! How we doing back there?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Not good! Not good at all!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Keep shooting!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I am! I hate this truck!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Hang on, Nathan!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, it’s right up on us!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m going as fast as I can! This is gonna be close! Holy shit.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: You good?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Let’s get outta here.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Text: [Next scene. Ikopa Motel.]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, I think the coast is clear.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. All right… “Pro Deus quod licentia.” This looks like a simple cipher.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: “For God and liberty.” It’s their damn motto. All the “paradise” references. I can’t believe we missed it.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: See you two made it out okay.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Way better than okay. We found Libertalia. (laughs]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Liber-- Liber-what-ia?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Libertalia. Seems Avery founded the legendary pirate colony.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s more of a pirate utopia really.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay. But what about the treasure?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: See, as the story goes… this place provided a safe haven for hundreds… maybe even thousands of pirates. And they shared everything. Property, resources…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Money?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: And they kept all in one common treasury building.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay. So… Where is this… Commie pirate sanctuary?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Right here. That island. Just northeast of King’s Bay.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: And Rafe has a copy of this.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, tell, by the time Rafe figures it out… we’ll be well on our way to Libertalia. Tellin’ ya that treasure… is as good as ours-- ssshit.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Text: [He sees Elena in their room.]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: How’s the Malaysia job going, Nate? Seems like you’re a hair off course.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Elena, it’s… It’s not what it looks like.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: Really. Because what it looks like… is that you’re searching for Henry Avery’s buried treasure. And given the Shoreline soldiers that are all over town… I’d bet you’re not the only ones looking for it.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, well I… I guess it’s kinda what it looks like. But, but I can explain. Look it’s gonna sound crazy.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: Try me.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, for starters, um… This is Sam. Sam Drake. My brother.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Hi.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’m sorry.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I, I thought he had died in a Panamanian jail.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: I need to--

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: But I was obviously very wrong. He’s been stuck in there for fifteen years. And it’s because of me. And the guy who broke him out wants a lot of money. And the only way we can pay off the debt is Avery’s treasure. But that’s the good news, we found it! It’s on an island just off the coast.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, just stop. Was there… ever… a Malaysia job?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay… (leaving]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, C’mon, wait. Elena, wait!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: I don’t get you.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Look, I wanted to tell you.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: You know what, enough.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: No, I wanted to! But how could I?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: I don’t know, just say it?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I had to protect you.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: That is bullshit, Nate. You just didn’t have the nerve to face me. Again.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I knew you would react like this.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: How would you react? You lied to me… for weeks. If you were killed, I… wouldn’t have even known about it. And now you have a brother? Who are you?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Come on. I’m me. C’mon, it’s me. It’s different this time.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh my God.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I have to save him. I don’t even care about the treasure.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Elena
Text: The look on your face when you walked into this room… If you’re done lying to me… then you should stop lying to yourself. I got a plane to catch. You do what you have to do. (leaves]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey… Hey, what are you doing? Go after her.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: We’re not done here.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, maybe we should be.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: What are you saying?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’m saying maybe there’s a smarter-way to save Sam.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Such as?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Such as, we give him a new identity. We… we… put him in hiding somewhere, I got contacts--

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: He’s been in prison for fifteen years-- he’s not going into hiding.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay, fine. You go after your wife. Sam and I will head off for Libertalia.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Without me? Come on, you’ll get both of you killed.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Really?  Kid, I’ve been doing this for a helluva long time. I think I might be able to handle--

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, you want to be helpful, Sullivan? Go keep an eye on her.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Whatever you say.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Need a hand with anything?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I got it. Just pack your bags.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Text: [Nate and Sam sailing on a yacht.]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, Nathan!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Land ho! What do you think out at, huh?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s pretty cool.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Take the wheel for a second. You know, all this running around, surviving by the skin of our teeth… I don’t think we’ve actually take to step back and appreciate… just how far we’ve come.  Huh? Sic parvis magna. (Greatness from small beginnings]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sic parvis magna. (Greatness from small beginnings]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah… Listen, little brother… she will get over it. I mean we bring back a treasure like that, anyone would.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t know. I think maybe I’ve, ah… done this one too many times.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Huh. Somehow I imagined it… bigger.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well, we’re definitely in the place. I’ll find us a spot to set ashore.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Well. I mean… at least there’s an island, right?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: At least there’s an island. Just keep an eye on anything man-made.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah-ah… you mean pirate-made.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Ha. Sure.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: So, maybe Libertalia is more of a small beachside shack…

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, maybe it’s a tree house.  Sam, let’s check this out.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Sounds good to me.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Supplies… from an earlier expedition.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: What you got there?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Burnes…? Holy crap, Sam… this was written by Burnes’ grandson!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, makes sense: the cross in Panama was hollow. Must be following the same clues as us.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Ready to go?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, let’s do this.  Nathan, up there!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, that definitely qualifies as man-made.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, ah… pirate-made.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Text: [Nate moors. They search the island.]

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh. It’s a door of some kind. Covering a… chamber?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: A massive chamber… for storing a bunch of treasure?

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: No way. Not with his ego. Wherever Avery put the treasure’s gonna be the most elaborate place we’ve seen yet. And it would be well protected too.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: That makes sense. Looks like an old lookout tower. Let’s see if we can spot something from up there.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, up we go. Sam, this way.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Sam
Text: This looks promising.

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate

Speaker: Nate

Speaker: Sam

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam!

Time/Location: I’ve never seen the monkey sigil before
Speaker: Nate
Text: All right… c’mon, Nate. I gotta get off this beach. Sam! Sam, can you hear me? Maybe farther up shore. All right, first things first-- get to higher ground. First rule, Higher ground. Find out where you are. Sam, c’mon answer me! Whoa Ah, shit. All right. Ah, Sam god damn it. Sam! Sam, are you there? Oh thank God, our supply box. Oh, for God’s-- Of course. Everything’s gone. Wait, maybe that’s a good sign. Maybe Sam took it. Well, on the bright side, can’t lose anything else… besides my life. Talking to myself, that’s-- that’s the first sign of… being crazy. Okay. I’m all right… I’m all right. Just push through… Just push through it. Whoa! No, no, no, no! C’mon. Oh, to hell with this place. Ah, damn it. Gotta keep going, gotta keep going. Aaaah! Come on. Aaaahhhh! S… Sic parvis magna. Sam… C’mon… Where are you? Crap.  Gotta get to that… creepy mountain. Just stay put, Sam… I’m coming to you. No-- no! Come on, come on. Ah! No! No, no, no! Okay… All right… All right… Up we go.  That’s a… that’s a long way… long way down. Whoa! Rafe. Ah, damn it… What if your back, Sam. Now what? That should hold… let’s hope. Whoa… Huh. Where to now? Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Jesus. Oooh! Aaah! That’s refreshing. Oh, hey. Seen anyone come by here? Tall… lanky… filled with big, stupid ideas about pirate treasure?  Bad luck, huh? (reads a note]

Speaker: Our crew and food stores diminished, I demanded we return home so that we might return with more men, more supplies. Burnes laughed - laughed! - and repeated his mantra
Text: the treasure is within our reach.

Speaker: I held firm
Text: even if we were to find Avery’s stash, with one ship remaining we shall barely have enough room for ourselves on the return voyage, let alone any Hindoo gold. I turned to First Mate Hayes for affirmation, but he backed away as though I had the Plague.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh… Poor bastards. Were you trying to climb up there? In those boots?  Pretty sure you don’t need this. Yeah. That’s working. Almost there. Okay… Oh, shit.
Action: (he takes a pylon from a skeleton)

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Oi, oi! (Hey, hey!) You got a target?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Saw something, maybe… movement along the treeline.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Well, that’s thick jungle over there, hey. It’s all moving. I don’t see anything.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Damn it. All right, everyone, false alarm! But keep an eye out! Let’s go.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: So which one of them did they spot?

Speaker: Mercenary 4
Text: The older brother. He shot a couple of our men and run off.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: You think the other one’s alive?

Speaker: Mercenary 4
Text: Until we find a body, I’m going to go with yeah.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: How’d they survive that wreck?

Speaker: Mercenary 4
Text: They keep getting lucky.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: Well, luck eventually runs out.

Speaker: Mercenary 4
Text: We’ll see.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh no. Whew. Oh, jeez. Perfect. Holy shit. Ah damn. Ah, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t. Oh shit. Oh no. Whoa… geez. Uh-oh. Uh. Okay. Where to?  What’s this?

Speaker: My time grows short and my hand weak. In the absence of Earth-bound Justice, I beseech you
Text: pray to God above that Burnes pays for his treachery.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow… that is pretty dark. Seems like Burnes’s crew had about as much luck as me with this treasure. Ah, you gotta be kidding me. Ah… Oh no. No! No, no! Holy shit.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Text: [He find Sam.]

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: I nearly shot your head off.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam… You’re okay.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Nothing I can’t walk away from. It’s good to see you’re alive, little brother. C’mon. We got a treasure to find.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Hold up, man, I mean-- What are we doing?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: What do you mean?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: I mean our supplies are at the bottom of the Indian Ocean.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay, so we go steal some from Nadine’s army.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, and there’s that… We’re going up against an army!

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: We’ve been holding our own so far.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: While being marooned in the middle of nowhere.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: We were flying to get here, remember?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: When we had an escape plan. Okay. Just hear me out-- crazy suggestion… let’s go down there and at least secure one of Rafe’s boats?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: The boats can wait. You want to know what we’re doing here? We are buying my life back. Okay. And we’re doing that by stepping into that jungle and finding Libertalia.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Have you even seen any signs of a massive pirate colony? ‘Cause I sure the hell haven’t.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: You’re a little late to start developing doubts, don’tcha think?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Look-- an we at least acknowledge the chance that maybe Avery’s idea for a secret pirate utopia didn’t pan out? And maybe we’re just swept up in this fantasy, when instead we should be looking for a real way to save you?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m gonna scour this island inch by inch if I have to-- until I find that treasure. Now, if you’re confused about what you’re doing here… then you can go home, Nathan.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, wait, wait. I can go home? Are you kidding me? Do you have any idea what I put on the line to get you here?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: How about what I put on the line? Okay? The last fifteen years of my life--

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, C’mon. This has nothing to do with that!

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: It is everything to do with that. What?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: (find Avery’s sigil) Holy crap.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: You still wanna go home?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s just see what else we can find.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: This way.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: I’ll be damned.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Off to a good start.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Let’s just hope the rest of it isn’t buried under centuries of dirt and rock.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Glass half full, if you please. Nathan, this way.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam. Up here.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m coming.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: No one’s home.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: This place has seen better days, huh?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, this way. Agh… Yeah, that‘s not happening.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, Nathan. Think there’s a way through here. Nathan, it’s this way.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Ahh. Feels good to stretch out again.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, gin said it. Hey, there’s a way out.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah… It’s too high, even for a boost… let’s find something to stand on.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: There’s a crate. I got an idea. Here we go. Heads up!

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Alright, we’re in business.  You’re gonna wanna see this.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: What do you see?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: No houses. Wide street. Clearly a commercial district of some kind.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Yes… thank you for that, Nathan. C’mon. What do you see?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: You just wanna hear me say it, don’t you?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Really want to hear you say it.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Libertalia.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Libertalia! The long-lost, legendary pirate utopia. Discovered, after three hundred years, by one Samuel Drake.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: And…

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: And… and his younger slightly less charming brother who happened to be tagging along for the ride. You know, I always knew you’d make something of yourself one day.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, just so you know, it’s not my first lost city.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Shhh. Shh. Just… Enjoy the moment. So where do you want to start?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: How about that building right over there.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, you mean the one with the massive guard tower?

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. I say we go see what it was guarding.

Chapter: The First Mate of the Suffolk
Speaker: Sam
Text: Works for me. This is-- I mean-- I’m speechless. Holy Goddamn shit, Nathan!

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s your idea of speechless?

Speaker: Sam
Text: God. How long do you think it took to build this place?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Years. Decades, even. How the hell did they keep it a secret all that time?  This letter’s still legible.

Speaker: For now, our location must remain secret. But I hope one day you can come here and see what we have accomplished
Text: a society free from the unjust subjection you have grown to accept.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, Sam, check it out. It like a pirate code a conduct.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hmm… thought the whole point of this place was not having rules?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Even pirate ships had their own rules. Locked, of course. Captain Avery. Was wondering when you’d turn up. Guess even a pirate utopia needs a place to lock up riff-raff.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Can you imagine who pirates put in prison? That’s a little hypocritical don’t you think? Pirates having a jail?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, I guess every group has its assholes. What’s this symbol?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I saw a few of them when I was coming to find you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So who’s marking these places? Is that another sigil?

Speaker: Sam
Text: No. Not that I know of…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Maybe invaders? I mean, I’m sure these guys had plenty of enemies out there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Pshh… That’s a good point.

Speaker: Nate
Text: This way follow me.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Looks like there’s a tunnel through here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey Sam. C’mere. This looks promising.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right behind you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Looks like a hideout of some kind.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, but who would they be hiding out from? Themselves?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look at this. Looks like the layout of the commercial district.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah and… Boom here’s our treasury right there. See, there’s the tower.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What were these guys up to? That’s our way out of here. I see some light down below… Shhh shhh. Look.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: There’s more building this way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah hell. Shoreline.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Jislaaik… It was a whole city, man.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I don’t think they’ve seen us yet.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Let’s keep it that way.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Keep your head down.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Did anyone get word to Nadine?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just about to tell you the same thing.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Ja, they’re on their way just now.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, yeah.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: So where do we go from here?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: I’m not the treasure hunter. Let’s keep the area secure ‘til he gets here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Sam
Text: They’re on us! Nathan, watch out! Jesus! Nice shot! Take cover! Good shot!

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Anyone see them?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah crap. More Shoreliners.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Not yet. Maybe our boys fixed ‘em up already?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: They would’ve called it in, I don’t like this.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Keep your cool and keep your eyes open.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Look out, armored guy. All right, you got him! I got one!

Speaker: Nate
Text: You see any more? Or we clear?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I think we’re clear.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You all right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Just a little winded. Nathan. Got s’more friends up ahead.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Eina! (Ouch!) Eish, this whole place is falling apart.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Pasop , man. You could see the whole building over the edge.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Hey, you ever done anything like this?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Nah. Overthrown a couple of governments, looted, villages --but this… this is something else.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: Any news on Nadine?

Speaker: Mercenary 4
Text: Yeah, some bridge collapsed. They’re having to drive around the river -- they’ll be here soon.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Heads up, on your left.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Okay gents stay sharp. Let’s keep this job nice and tidy for the Boss lady.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Bad guy over there. Nathan, they’ve seen us! Shotgun! Watch it! Find some cover!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa, shit. That’s it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: For now. We just better keep moving.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Over here. C’mon, ready?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ready. Okay. All right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Careful… it’s a long way down.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I see it. Oh crap! Whoo. Watch that first step.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s a doozy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, ladder’s busted in the middle.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s a hell of a view.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Almost there, Sam!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay… now that?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Trust me and follow my lead. Okay?

Speaker: Sam
Text: So, do all of that then?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Something like that.  We’re definitely in the high-rent district now.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Not residential, though. What do you think? Some kind of administration building?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Probably. Maybe Libertalia had a zoning committee?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah… maybe they paid taxes?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Who knows? Nothing up here… Holy crap.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well; I see our missing colonists.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus. Cannons… improvised barricades… What the hell happened here?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Some kind of battle.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s a a rhetorical question.

Speaker: Sam
Text: (sighs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: The real question is: who’s fighting who? And why?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Some of these bodies are dressed a bit more fancy. Look like soldiers.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Man… this is impressive.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, to say the least.

Speaker: Nate
Text: And here… we… go.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Or not. You wanna give me a hand?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s empty.

Speaker: Nate
Text: ‘Course it is.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You think Rafe?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. Nothing’s been touche in here for hundreds of years.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right… Well… search for clues?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Search for clues.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Empty.  “Thief”. What’s this? Old manifest. Lots of treasure.  Captain Avery… You’ve certainly seen better days. Nah. Hello. Huh.  Another one. Is this what was on the shelves?
Action: (search a driver) (looking at portrait) (looking at statue) (find a note)

Speaker: Sam
Text: Wait a sec. Nathan! Over here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’d you got?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Libertalia money.

Speaker: Nate
Text: This has Avery’s sigil on it…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Um-hm.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He must-have melted down the old, minted his own currency…

Speaker: Sam
Text: So based on that, all the manifests on the shelves… the treasure was here. That leaves the bigger question-- where is it now?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay… so we know that there was fighting outside.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah and inside.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What, you think the colonists stole it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No… I think they were trying to reclaim what was theirs. Look. Here’s Avery, Tew… Founders of Libertalia. All marked with the word “thief”. Not “murderer”, not “tyrant”.

Speaker: Sam
Text: “Thief”. So by the time the colonists busted in here… treasure was already gone.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, because these guys had already taken it for themselves. Pirates will be pirates, right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, pirates will be pirates. Huh. I know where they moved it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where? It’s a map.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, right there… that’s our treasury…

Speaker: Nate
Text: This-- it’s a map of Libertalia…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right, so follow it to the other side of the island and look… right there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: “New Devon”. Wait. Avery was from Devon, England.

Speaker: Sam
Text: He sure was. Man, those are some seriously large mansions.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Each of them has its own sigil too.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Because that’s where they lived. (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whaddaya say we uh-- climb that watch tower huh? Get our bearings?

Speaker: Sam
Text: New Devon here we come.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Now… how do we get up there?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay, ready? Okay, that’s step one. Step two…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Raise the chandelier. Good idea.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ha. You sound surprised.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just take the compliment.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Thank you. All right. Now the place is looking classy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s get up there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, nice one, Tarzan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, sorry, Condent.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Baldridge.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: You’re stepping on Baldridge.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. So I am. All right, up we go.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m really shocked the stairs are intact.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, hey, hey. Don’t jinx us.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoops. Spoke too soon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Like I said.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, you seeing this tower?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure am. Hey Sam?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah?

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right. Just making sure you haven’t plummeted to your death.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ha ha. Just about there!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh. He sure is excited. Need a lift?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’d love a lift.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, ready?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ready. All right. Found something. Hey, stand back! Here… you… go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. Quite the crow’s nest, huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: There it is. Just on the other side of the river.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, whaddya say we go… rob from the rich, huh? Hey, is there a path down here?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, of sorts. C’mon. So, how long you figure it’ll take us to get to New Devon?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, couple hours. Depends on what or who we bump into along the way.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, shit! Nathan! RPG!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah! Shit! You all right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah! Come on! Through these windows!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ahh! Sam, lookout! Move!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Jesus!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa! These guys love blowing shit up, don’t they?!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! Down here!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m coming!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m down here! Come on!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, God damn it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Look out!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa shit! Jesus, that was close.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Something tells me they’ve had enough of us.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really? What gives you that idea?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Down here, quick! Get up, brother, we gotta go! We gotta go! Now! Oh! Oh shit!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t wait, just go!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh… God!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Shit, shit, shit! Assholes.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Come on! Up here! Climb up the rope!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, great.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon! C’mon! Oh, what the hell?!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Run! Ahh-- !

Speaker: Sam
Text: Quick! Whooaa! Don’t stop. Don’t slow down. Don’t stop. Don’t slow down!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jump!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nate. There. Whoa.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, this is nuts. Run!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Keep running! Don’t stop! Grenade! Damn it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh no! Aaahhh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, I’m gonna feel this in the morning.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Asshole!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Kick his ass, Sam. Shit. All right… let’s try this again. Okay, wait, wait. Hey Nadine. Great to see you again. Ow! Okay, Mango! Mango!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: What are you on about…?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ow, well it’s my safe word.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Hm. Are you always this clever?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I have my moments.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Yes. You and your brother have proven yourselves the more capable treasure hunters on the island. Shame we’re not on the same side.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait there’s… there’s still time.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Trust a Drake? Hm. I’m not falling for that again.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, hey, iust-- just let’s just talk about this. Okay, that was a… bit rougher than expected. I’ll just ah… see myself out.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: After everything… you think I’m just going to let you walk away?

Speaker: Sam
Text: That’d be the wise thing to do.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh come on Nadine, really? We know you’re a bad-ass and all, but… there’s two of us.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: You don’t think my men are on their way here right now? All I have to do is buy some time. That’s if I don’t finish you myself.

Speaker: Nate
Text: God damn it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Go!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I’m tired of this island! Tired of your brother! And I’m tired of you!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, no you don’t!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Get off!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh. Ah, how does she do that?

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Can we just talk about this?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I don’t think so.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Now-- now hold on!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: No!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Oh no you don’t…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah. Hang in there Sam. I’m coming.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: How many men I’ve lost? Of course not. It’s all just a game to you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Almost there, Sam. Nadine!

Speaker: Sam
Text: You’re fast… but you’re not that fast.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey forget about her. We gotta get out of here before they--  Shit. Whoa, whoa, whoa. Everybody just… Just calm down, okay?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Well, this is interesting. Nate. Samuel.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Put your guns down! All of you.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: No.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Rafe, this guy’s on edge.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh, don’t worry about him, Nadine. These guys don’t kill anyone in cold blood. It’s just not their style.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You willing to bet her life on that?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Go ahead then. Shoot her.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I die you both die.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So be it. Not another step!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You mean… like this?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam… put the gun down.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I warned you.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Do it.
[Sam shoots but Nate takes his gun.]

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Rafe!

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s done!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Hold your fire! Don’t shoot! (to NatePut it down?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s done. Okay? It’s done.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: “Don’t worry Nadine. It’s not their style.”

Speaker: Rafe
Text: What can I say? I didn’t think he hid it in him. Samuel. You okay? I guess you knew this moment was coming, huh? (hits him]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey! C’mon, man. You got got us. Take it easy. C’mon now, you’re a businessman. Let’s just… work it out a deal.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh, a deal. Oh yeah, I’d love to hear what you have in mind.  Oh, you can go ahead. I’m listening.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, just… all right… look, you wanna find Avery’s treasure? We’ll help you find it.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: And in exchange, I let you live?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. That… and a small cut…

Speaker: Rafe
Text: The gauchos on this guy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just enough to get his freedom, okay?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: His freedom?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan--

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. He did hard time. Our time. And he guy who broke him out, Hector Alcazar… he owes’ him a lot of money.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Whoa. What the hell are you talking about, Nate? Hector Alcazar died in a shootout in Argentina like six months ago. I’m the one that got Samuel out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What-- ?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Ohhhhh. Wow. What did he tell you? Sam, what kind of story did you cook up? Alcazar? Really? You lied? You lied to your baby brother?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: We’re wasting time.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Just a second.  Thing is, Nate; I never stopped looking for Avery’s treasure. I just kept running into these dead ends.  You know? And then I hear that our dear ol’ Samuel Drake, an authority on Avery-- is alive and somewhat well. There was no breakout. I bribed the prison warden and your brother waltzed right out the front gate., he just He spent the last two years tracking down the second St. Dismas Cross. And you know what? He did It all with me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, that’s bullshit.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh Sam? Care to refute?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nate…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aw, Sam… Ah, Jesus no, no…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Listen, Avery’s treasure was ours… It was always ours.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No! I left my life for you!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Hey look, look, Nate, if it’s any consolation, he duped me too. He pulled Houdini on me. He brought you… and that old man back into the mix. And I cannot lie, Sam, that really… pissed me off. But you know… all behind us now.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You don’t deserve it.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You do? Last I checked we’re all a bunch of thieves… digging around where we shouldn’t.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Rafe?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: What?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: One way or another end it. Or I will.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Well, you heard the lady.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, you miss one clue and you can kiss that treasure goodbye. You said it yourself: you keep running into dead ends. Why don’t you face it, Rafe. You need us.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Yeah, you’re right. You’re half right. I just need Sam.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait now, you’re making a mistake, you got--

Speaker: Sam
Text: Rafe, don’t! Rafe, don’t, don’t, listen I--
[Rafe shoots at him, but Sam takes the bullet. Nate fall of cliff into the sea.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh… Oh my God. Nate. Hey. Nate! Nate!
[We switch back into Nate’s past. He and his brother ride up a motorcycle to a mansion in which their late mother’s things are kept.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well… there it is.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Who the hell lives here, anyway?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I have no idea. But this is definitely the address. Been scoping the place out for the past few days. No one’s home.

Speaker: Sam
Text: And here we are.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa… This place is humongous.

Speaker: Sam
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where do we even start?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Eh well, we start by finding a way in. And then we can take the grand tour.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You think this place has an alarm?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Let’s try and find a way in that doesn’t involve breaking a window. See? What’d I tell you?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, it was worth a try.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m pretty sure the front door will be locked.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jeez… what do you think a place like this costs?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I think knowing the answer would make you sad. All right. Let’s look around back, huh? Hey, Nathan-- look. It’s an open window.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Here, follow me. Okay, gimme your hand. All right. There you go. C’mon, Nathan. Whoa.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Huh.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Huh.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Spooky.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Well, here. I brought a spare.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, are we looking for any particular room?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just keep an eye out for any books, journals, any kind of research papers, you know?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hmm, nothing in here.  Nope.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Eh, it’s not going to be in this attic. Boxes are filled with old traveling and camping equipment. Down we go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, how do we Ind them?

Speaker: Sam
Text: What, Mom’s notebooks? I mean, don’t you remember? She always used that off-white leather binding.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here we go. White leather.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I think I found one. For real? You got the right idea, though. Let’s keep looking.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Was this your house?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, these boxes remind you of anything?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Every place we ever lived?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Exactly.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I remember Dad always being like,Why bother unpacking? We’re just gonna move again in a month.”

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yep. Always the asshole.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey Sam… call me crazy but This looks like a Ming Dynasty vase.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, who in their right mind would have a Ming Dynasty vase just sitting around like that? Nah… it’s probably a knock off of some kind.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh -- It won’t budge.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Here. Let’s do it together. You ready? Push. What the hell?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. It’s… some sort of sarcophagus.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah… look around… This whole place is filled with sarcophaguses er… sarcophagi.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hmm. Sam… this is real.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What is this place? Let’s go find out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh, this one’s Roman… third… maybe fourth century. Hmmmm.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, you recognize that one?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh… I… I’ve seen something like it before.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Reclining figures… It’s Etruscan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… that’s right.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, husband and wife… buried together. It’s kind of dark… in like an awesome sort of way.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: This place is like a damn museum.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Think they’ve got a dinosaur wing?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Wouldn’t surprise me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here’s another one…  Nope.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I do believe this is an ancient Mesopotamian washer/dryer combo.

Speaker: Nate
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Sam
Text: I was the funny one. Always was. Hey, Nathan, check me out. Now who am I? Huh? Dr. Livingston, c’mon. (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nice. (Looking at invitation to Adventurer's Gala) Man… what I wouldn’t give to get an invite like this.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So, where are we going?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, if you could go anywhere in the world. Where would you pick?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Anywhere?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Anywhere.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, well… Here we go… India.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, we’ll visit the Taj Mahal.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Round and round she goes… Soviet Union. Let’s go to Moscow.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah might be a tad difficult to get in. Always wanted to see the Red Square though.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s try again… England.  Sure would be cool to see Windsor Castle… Right, Sam?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey. Hey, don’t look at me. It’s not my fault you weren’t’ born yet. It’s not like I remember much of it anyways And… It wasn’t that cool.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh huh… Okay… one last spin. Brazil.

Speaker: Sam
Text: He w you’re talking! All kinds of undiscovered places in the rain forest.

Speaker: Nate
Text: And all kinds of undiscovered tribes with poison darts.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah… that too.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, check it out!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hail, Caesar!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Fertility totems.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, aren’t you a little young to be looking at that stuff?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow. This table’s as big as the ones in the orphanage dining hall.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I bet the food here was better.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wouldn’t take much.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Damn, they must’ve thrown some great parties in here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Judging by the artifacts… they certainly had enough money for it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. Looks like it’s been a long time since the last one, though.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Woah… Lawrence of Arabia. Jousting armor. Looks French.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, maybe don’t go waving your flashlight around the windows too much?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hmm. It’s locked.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Mom’s stuff might be in one of these rooms… we gotta find another way in. Hey… the air vent. Up there!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh yeah… That could get us into the room below it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Not us. You.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I… I can’t fit in there. Can you handle it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You kidding me? “Can I handle it?”

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right. Let’s see what you got then. Is that a latter? Heh. Nice-- liven up the place.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’s left of it. Someone wanted to buy their stuff…

Speaker: Sam
Text: ‘Scuse me, I am a man of many tastes.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Guess they said no.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, you ready? Oh, whoops.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s a Polaroid.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, lemme see. I think it still works. C’mere. Now smile, all right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Sam
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Don’t lose it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay -- up here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: A dragon gong. Huh. Looks like it’s from Southeast Asia.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nice.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Going it alone. Look at these. Compass, sundial…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just imagine being lost at sea, and those instruments are the only thing standing between death and salvation.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. It’s crazy. Hey, they’ve got your favorite book here.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Really? Which one?

Speaker: Nate
Text: “A General History of the Robberies and Murders of the Most Notorious Pirates.”

Speaker: Sam
Text: More like “a generally made-up history.” Even the author’s name is a fake.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, don’t fall.

Speaker: Nate
Text: There.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’ll see ya on the other side.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. It’s a good thing I’m not claustrophobic. All right…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Can you get the door open?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh… hold on. Huh. Codine. Lots of painkillers.  It’s locked from this side too.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Look around is there a key nearby?
[Nate finds a note.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Got it.

Speaker: Sam
Text: So… anything?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Didn’t see any journals.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, well, we still got the other locked door so, c’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, wow…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Journals galore… Well, let’s see what we find.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. Sam.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What, you got something?  This is it! (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Riches of paradise…? Whoa… Henry Avery… Gunsway heist…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa… Oh, what do you got there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: We never seen this one.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, me either. But that-- Yeah, no, that’s definitely mom’s handwriting.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Put up your hands. Slowly.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, hey, hey. There’s no need for that.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: What is he holding?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, hey, hey! You keep your gun on me.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Give me my journal. (coughs]

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right… all right… I’m sorry, Nathan. So, what now?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Now… we wait…  for the police.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, you don’t want to have to deal with that headache…

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Stop.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I mean, the hassle of ruining two kids’ lives. That’s--

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: I really don’t want to shoot you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon, lady. It was no harm no foul, all right?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: We all must face the consequences of our actions. Hmm?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Then at least let him go. I brought him down here so he could see our mom’s stuff. That’s it. He had nothing to do with this.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: What?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m telling you that this is all on me.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: No. Your mother’s… stuff?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, that-- that journal… it was our mom’s.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: You’re Cassandra Morgan’s boys.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh… hi.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: My God.  I could’ve shot you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah, you still might, so uh… do you mind?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You knew our mom?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: She worked for me. As I’m sure you’ve noticed… I’m a collector of sorts.

Speaker: Sam
Text: That’s sort of an understatement.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So… Mom was, like, your translator?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Your mother… was the most brilliant historian I have ever met. We could have accomplished so much together. But then her illness it… I’m sorry.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, It’s all right. Happened a long time ago.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Of all of her discoveries… his would have been her crowning achievement. “Sic parvis magna.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Greatness from small beginnings.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Sir Francis Drake’s motto. Yeah, Latin and historical figures-- Those were our dinner conversations. We were ah, a weird family.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Did she ever tell you her theories… regarding Sir Francis Drake and his heirs?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Uh…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sir Francis Drake didn’t have a y heirs.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Uh-huh. That’s what history tells us. But your mother and I believed otherwise. Learning that old pirate’s secrets is one more adventure I have to let go. I guess there’s a lot I have to let go… Forgive me. Ramblings of an old woman. Here. It is as much yours as it is mine. Who knows? Perhaps one day you’ll be able to finish what she started.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah… ah, so uh… Yeah, so uh… we’re off the hook, right?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: I’ll handle the police. You found your way in. I trust you can see yourself out, hmm?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: Thank you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m sorry about the mess.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, C’mon, Nathan. Let’s go.

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: (gasps]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you okay?

Speaker: Old Woman
Text: (exhales sharply]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Holy shit. No, no, no, no, no, no. Hey! Hey! Hey!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam?

Speaker: Cop
Text: Ma’am?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, crap.

Speaker: Cop
Text: It’s the police! You all right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, we have to do something.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah. We need to get the hell outta here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Can’t just leave her here.

Speaker: Sam
Text: There’s nothing we can do for herw. All right, we have to run. If the cops find us here then there’s--

Speaker: Cop
Text: Ma’am?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! We gotta go. Right now. Oh, shit. Window! Window, c’mon!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Okay. You -- check upstairs. You – come with me.

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Copy that.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hurry.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait up.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Hey, you check over by that fountain?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Don’t see ‘em.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aah! Crap.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Careful.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Haven’t heard back from the guys inside.

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: It’s a big place. Might take a while.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam!

Speaker: Sam
Text: I got you. Just jump! The chimney. C’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Comin’.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Search the gardens! I’ll go look behind the house.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Ah, damn it.

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Took you guys long enough.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: We’re here, aren’t we? What’ve you got?

Speaker: Sam
Text: The front gate looks clear.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Two suspects, one juvenile. They’re on the grounds somewhere.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Front gate. Got it.

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: They armed?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, go slow.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay.  Aah! Agh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! You all right?

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: The hell was that?! You there! Don’t move!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Run for it! This way! We can lose ‘em!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: This is Officer Murphy, we’ve got two burglary suspects on foot. One adult, one juvenile, both male…

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Freeze, God damn it!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: You there! Down on the ground, hands on your head!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, shit.

Speaker: Cop
Text: Stop, God damn it!

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon! Go, go, go!

Speaker: Cop
Text: There! There they are! Gotcha!

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon, go!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: Call for backup!

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: I did already!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: One more warning! Down on the ground! Hands on your heads! Gotcha!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, shit.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa! Here, come on…. Run!

Speaker: Cop
Text: Stop, God damn it!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, run! You get outta here!

Speaker: Cop
Text: There! By the guest house!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Run!

Speaker: Cop
Text: Aw, shit. They’re bolting!

Speaker: Sam
Text: The dumpster, c’mon!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay!

Speaker: Cop 1
Text: They’re getting away!

Speaker: Cop 2
Text: Go back around! Back to the main gate!

Speaker: Sam
Text: On the bike, now! C’mon! All right, hold on tight! (they drive away]
[Next scene]

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’d say we’re clear. How about we catch our breath a second.  Some night, huh?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Some night. That old lady…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey… Hey, you listen to me, that wasn’t our fault back there. I mean, that lady she She was umm… sick. I mean, it’s okay to feel bad. But there was nothing we could do about it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, what are we gonna do now? I can’t go back the orphanage. You can’t go back to your job.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Then we don’t.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, I’m serious. We get as far away from this place as we possibly can.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah? And how long ‘til the cops find us?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, I think they’ll be looking for Nathan and Samuel Morgan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, that’s us.

Speaker: Sam
Text: What if it wasn’t? Nathan-- back at that mansion… you knew just as much about that stuff as that poor old lady. Here. I always felt that we were destined… for something great… but, until tonight… I didn’t know what that meant. But this… Mom’s unfinished work… This is our chance… to restart our lives. With brand new identities.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I know some guys. Pretty good at forging papers, too. Now as for our new name… Mom believed that Sir Francis Drake had heirs. Who’s to say he didn’t?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You’re serious, aren’t you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, we were meant for this. And I promise… you and me, together? We’re gonna go far. So what do you say… Nathan Drake?
[Scene changes to present day. Elena help Nate with his wounds.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: And everything changed after that. Y’know, we became… explorers. Adventurers. Mostly thieves. Ow.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, just hold still.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know, for a while it felt like… if we weren’t taking turns going to jail… it was because we were in jail together. And… after I lost him, I-- Or, after I thought… I lost him--

Speaker: Elena
Text: You didn’t want to bring him back up again.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Something like that. Well, that’s it. Now you know everything.

Speaker: Elena
Text: With you, I doubt that that’s everything. But… it’s a lot.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Love to know what you’re thinking.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’m thinking that you’re lucky that I found you when I did.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’m glad you didn’t lose a limb or anything. It would’ve been a royal pain getting you out of here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: How did you find me, anyway?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh you know, easy. Just follow the sound of gunfire.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. No, I mean, how did you get here…?  Oh… of course.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Come in, Sully.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, darlin’. How’s he doing?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, you know, he’s banged up, but he’s alive. Par for the course.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ow…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Now we just need to rescue the other Drake.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’ll let Nate tell you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, pal. Glad you could join us.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah, wouldn’t miss it. So what happened to Sam?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Rafe’s got him.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Shit. You know where they are?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. They’re headed to the northern side of the island. See if you can find a place to set down over there. Once we get Sam, we’re going to need to get outta here pretty quick.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Copy that. Hey, hey-- What about the treasure?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Forget it. We don’t need it.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: But Alcazar?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. There’s no Alcazar. It’s all bullshit.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Wait. You mean… the debt, the… the escape?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Sam made it all up. What an asshole, right. Look, I’ll fill you in on everything when I see you.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah. I can’t wait. Look, you two be safe down there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know us.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Trade ya. (give Nate a gun and take the radio]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Sure.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, I mean… Thanks for saving me. Again.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I almost didn’t this time.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Right…

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mon. I got us a ride.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So… we’re head northern side of the island?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, New Devon. It’s home to the founders of Libertalia.

Speaker: Elena
Text: And that’s where Rafe is taking your brother.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Treasure’s probably there; just need to save Sam before they find it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Look. Up there. I borrowed it from your Shoreline friends.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You slid all the way down from there?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, it was the quickest way to get down to you. Now we just gotta figure out another way back up. Nate -- boost me up this ladder?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, here. So… have you been here long?

Speaker: Elena
Text: On the island? A few hours now.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Did you see the colony?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I did. From the air.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Pretty incredible, right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I didn’t get the full tour… I was a little preoccupied with finding you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Right. So… Did ah, Sully fill you in on the deal with this place?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Henry Avery, four hundred million, twelve founders, hundreds of colonists… something like that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, that just about covers it.

Speaker: Elena
