Text: Wow… is that an elevator?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure looks like it. I swear, Avery recruited the best engineers of his time.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He must’ve used it to move supplies up river.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, that’s a fair bet. There’s your car. Just need to get up there.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, what do you think? Which way?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, let’s take a look. Here we go. I can boost you up there.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Great.  Whoa! Oh. Sorry… Hey, do you think there’s another way up?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey I see a path up here. There’s a way through over there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: See if you can find something I can use.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yup. Hey, I found something. Hold on… Look out below.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks. Nope. Whoa… Hey, nice jump!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Not bad, right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Way to go, Nate. Piss a girl like that off. Idiot.

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mon. I’ll meet you around.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh no. Not good. Not good.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate!?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m okay…! Sort of. Everything’s under control.

Speaker: Elena
Text: See if you can get back up here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… yeah, roger that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate? Can you find a way out of there?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It Io Its like a dead end.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, maybe the elevator still works…?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I doubt it. It’s 300 years old. Been exposed to the weather. I mean who knows if it ever work--

Speaker: Elena
Text: Got it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh look. It works.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Going up?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Next floor, menswear.  Ohh… jinxed it. You know, I’ll just ah… meet I guess.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Chips, you got any smokes?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Who the hell-- ?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh! Crap. Oh no.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Holy shit. Uh… nice moves… hun.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nothing to it. Now then… Which way’s the car?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’ll be easier to spot from higher ground.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Right, good idea.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, we’re getting some exercise at least, right?

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: There’ nobody here. It’s definitely the one she stole, though.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Look. Shoreline.

Speaker: Nate
Text: They found your car.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Technically, it’s their car.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, let’s get it back.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: You think she’s with Drake?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Gotta be. Some of the men said they heard a prop plane, too.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Sounds like a party.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Stay alert, gentlemen.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, sniper! Oh man.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap! Son of a bitch!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whew.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, crap!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wanna hop in and drive the hell out of here?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Might be worth a shot! Okay. I think that’s it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Shoreline’s certainly earned that reputation. Let’s go before more of ‘em shows up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, you see a way out?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Up river. There’s an opening by the falls.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow. Check out that elevator.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s massive.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I’m guessing New Devon’s at the top.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Then let’s get up there. So here’s question: why does Rafe Adler want Avery’s treasure? It’s not like he needs the money.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He wants the glory. Doesn’t want to be known as a guy who only got rich because of his inheritance. Walking away isn’t an option for him.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, Rafe is a good match for Shoreline. He needs their muscle and they need his money.

Speaker: Nate
Text: They do? They seem pretty well stocked.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Shoreline got involved in a couple of civil wars that didn’t pan out for them. Nadine inherited her father’ mess. She’s probably hopping that this’ll put her back on the map. So far good. Keep heading up stream.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Bet you could write a killer article about all this.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I could. I doubt anybody would believe it.

Speaker: Nam
Text: Well, you could take pictures, too.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I didn’t bring my camera. Kinda wish I did though. So… why do you think Sam didn’t come straight to you? After Rafe got him out of prison?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I think he wanted to gather every clue that Rafe had on Avery before bailing on him. Plus, he needed time to come up with that crazy Alcazar story. Ugh, I mean-- If I had just looked it up… That is one crazy contraption.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It looks big enough to fit the car.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here’s hoping this one works as well. All right, let’s look around. There we go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Stand clear, I got it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay!

Speaker: Elena
Text: How’s that?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Looks like I can get up there now. Thank you. Okay… Agh. There.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Anything?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nothing yet. Gonna climb higher. Need an elevator just to fix the elevator.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You made it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Was there ever a doubt?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wait, hold on. I got an idea. Okay, ready!

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s my girl.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’m gonna detach the finch now.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay!

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’ll bring the car to the elevator.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here… we… go… Ha ha! We did it!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, what the hell--? Nate, the elevator’s moving! Get on, quick!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap. I’m coming!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, hurry!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, hi there.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hi. Um… now what?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hm… maybe I need to… Oh, never mind.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay. Nate, watch out!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Stay down! Use the car as cover! Let me see if I can flank them.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Sniper!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Right.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey! Get off my elevator!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Elena, you still with me?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I’m still here. The car’s got some holes in it, though. Watch it! Sniper! Get back!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Damn it. She’s a sitting duck in there. C’mon. Move it, Nate. Holy hit.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Are you okay, Nate?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well? C’mon! You drive.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You sure? You seem to be doing fine.

Speaker: Elena
Text: After all that… I need a break.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well… definitely earned it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So I was thinking… All this engineering and architecture, it doesn’t come cheap. Do you think there’s even any treasure left?

Speaker: Nate
Text: We were wondering that ourselves.

Speaker: Elena
Text: There’s the elevator.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here goes nothing. Whoa. Hang on. Ah, there. I got control again.

Speaker: Elena
Text: We’re getting there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You didn’t happen to bring us some spare clothes, did ya?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I did.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Great.

Speaker: Elena
Text: They’re on the plane.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Not great.

Speaker: Elena
Text: That dam… we c an drive through the sluice gate.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here we go…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, Nate, it’s no good – it’s blocked.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. I’ll try the other one. Shoulda seen that coming. And behind door number two… Looks like this one’s clear!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nice work!

Speaker: Nate
Text: We’re good. Watch this. Hang on!

Speaker: Elena
Text: We did it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, you sound surprised.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Maybe a little.

Speaker: Nate
Text: And… we’re up. What are the odds that elevator’s working?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Eh, so far we’re two for two.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Leah, which means we’re due for some disaster.

Speaker: Elena
Text: The water wheel’s working. That bodes well.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, give me hand with this? Ah, crap. I’ll hold it. Just get the car. Oh God. Ah, that’s heavy. Okay. Here goes nothing.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Three for three.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You gotta love that rate engineering.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wow. It’s like a postcard.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, Libertalia. Come or the beautiful views… Stay for the life-or-death gunfights.

Speaker: Elena
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: So, what made you change your mind?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hm?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You said you… almost didn’t come back.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, I couldn’t leave then you were clearly in over your head. And you know, here’s that whole “marriage vow” thing.

Speaker: Nate
Text: For better or worse.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. For better or worse. Here. Gimme a hand with this.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay. You know, even if you think that you’re protecting me… you don’t have a right to shut me out like that. No matter what it is… you’re supposed to come to me so that we can work through it… together! As a team.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know that. Really, I do. It’s just… I, I, I… (sighs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: We should stay focused. There be time for this later.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Next stop: New Devon.
[They drive in silence. A beautiful piano piece plays.]

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, Elena? Nate?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We’re here, Sully. Where are you?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Still in the air. Saw a bunch of Shoreline vehicles heading north.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I guess we’ll see them soon.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You two doing okay so far?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We hit a few hitches but… so far so good.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: All right, good. Keep in touch, will ya? I’m not the ‘no news is good news’ type.

Speaker: Elena
Text: We’ll try. Over and out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Should be on the other side of the bridge. Hung on tight…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hold on!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Floor it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, I hate bridges! No, no no no no! Aaahh! Ah, hell--

Speaker: Elena
Text: Turn around, we’re heading for the falls!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I can’t… current’s too strong!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, there! We can climb up those rocks!

Speaker: Nate
Text: On it! All right. Go! Go!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ah, I got it! Come on!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Come on…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate! Agh…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah…  waterfall… Waterfall! Haha! Ha…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate!

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s okay! I’m okay!

Speaker: Elena
Text: The tree! The tree is not okay!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, come on!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Over here! Quick! Gotcha! Well. So much for the car.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I wasn’t trying to protect you. It-- it’s just I-- I made a, promise that I was done with this life.

Speaker: Elena
Text: We both did.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, but I broke it. I didn’t tell you because. I was afraid…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Afraid of what?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Of losing you. I guess I was, um… protecting myself. You know?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We have a lot of ground to cover.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Should keep moving.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. This way.

Speaker: Nate
Text: At least we’re on the right side of the river now.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. That would’ve been bad. I see an opening up there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Good call. Now… how do we get up there?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Avery sure picked a gorgeous island.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, maybe we can come back here on a vacation, huh?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, maybe.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, it’s slippery.  Oh, out by your lonesome? Well, rest in peace my pirate friend. Whoa.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, yikes.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hello.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Who is this…?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, look at the sign. “Traitor.” It’s one of the rebels.

Speaker: Elena
Text: That’s a bad way to die. Here’s another one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sorry, buddy. No disrespect.

Speaker: Elena
Text: More gibbets.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh my God.
[Nate and Elena finally find New Devon.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, I guess that’s one way to crush a rebellion.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I have to wonder if this was always the plan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What… to slaughter all the colonists?

Speaker: Elena
Text: No… To lure them here in hopes of finding a utopia. Only to rob them of everything that they have.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, we’re dealing with a bunch of pirates.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well… that is pretty diabolical, even for pirates.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just need your help for a sec.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Those things not look steady.

Speaker: Nate
Text: They’re not. Be careful. Whoa! Excuse me. Come on. You all right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow. Welcome to Avery’s neighborhood.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s a nice place. If you don’t mind some structural problems and water damage.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Clearly some drainage issues.

Speaker: Elena
Text: A real fixer-upper opportunity. Okay, so… Looks like somebody blew that dam and then flooded the whole place.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know, I forgot. Pretty good at this.

Speaker: Elena
Text: All right, so which one of these do you think is Avery’s?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, my money’s on… that one. One that’s still intact.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ooh. You’re not so bad at this either.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well, you know, had a little practice, read a few books.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Shit. Shit.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: The front door.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He’s still alive.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, for now. Come on. All right, keep your eyes open for Shoreline types… Here goes nothing. Whoops.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You all right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Through here. Watch your head. Oh, someone had it in for this guy. Oh, another one note. Shit. Shoreline. Elena, get down.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I see them.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Patrols haven’t come back with our 4x4. Drake’s probably still out there. So lock this place down. We need to be prepared if they show up.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, look out.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: More prepared than the river patrol was. What’s that?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Ah, nothing, boet .

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Had better be nothing…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Watch it.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: All this for one man?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: After everything, you’re really asking me that?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Ha. Fancy digs. Certainly doesn’t look like a pirates’ house. Where’s all the valuables?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: The brother’s leading them on a wild goose chase. Why haven’t they shot the scaly bastard yet?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Rafe has his reasons, I reckon.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I got him! Sniper! Get down! Nate, sniper!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. Shit. Whoa. That‘s too close. Oh, great. Whoa, shit. Whoa… geez. Jesus. I think that’s it, You okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Let’s push on. Might be a way through this cave.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, it’s worth a look. Ah crap. How many people did you bring here, Nadine?

Speaker: Elena
Text: She does have an entire army. You think they found the treasure?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, legs hope not. For Sam’s sake. Look, something here. It’s addressed to Richard Want. Signed Adam Baldridge.

Speaker: Elena
Text: They were both Founders?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. Okay. Current’s a little strong Might come in handy. Look out below.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nice one.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Crap. Can’t get a held of it. Come… come to papa. After you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Aw, how sweet. You want me to be your decoy?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, I was being gentlemanly there.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just busting your chops.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well the chops are plenty busted already. Thank you. Oh shit.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whoa. Nate!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hang on! Agh -- whoa!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whoa!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah no no! Whoa!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ugh.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s wasn’t too bad.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whew.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I’m fine… You?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, wet again. Tired, bruised. A little hungry. I could eat.  Other than that I’m, me.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah… Whew… Okay, C’mon. Let’s keep going.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, let’s try cutting through this house.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I’m right behind you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh, what’s this? Jesus. Got all “Lord of the Flies” in here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No kidding.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, check it out. These cannons looks like they were retrofitted.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Improvised defenses. Guess they didn’t expect they’d be fighting each other.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Guess not. Ooh. Nice water feature. Time for another swim, I guess. Whoa, whoa. Stronger than it looks.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hold up. I’ll weigh it down for you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Great. Okay!

Speaker: Elena
Text: You’re welcome!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thank you. You make a great counterweight. Uh… I mean…

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s okay, I’ll choose to take that as a commitment.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Swallowed some water. I made it. I’ll find a way up for you. This should work. All right, stand clear… There you go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, great!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let‘s move this out of the way.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yup.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Hey look-- Thomas Tew’s sigil.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So we’re in his mansion.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Second in command. Going up the pirate hierarchy.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Good lord.
Action: (sees many dead pirate captains at a table)

Speaker: Nate
Text: Looks like we found the party.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Looks like we’re a little late.

Speaker: Nate
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, Nate. Check it out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s another sigil. Oh my God…

Speaker: Elena
Text: What?

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s them. Elena, these are the pirate captains that founded Libertalia. What the hell happened here?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, I’m no forensics expert, but I would say… bad drinks?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Apparently.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So, what was this? Some kind of… wealthy pirate suicide cult?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, not likely. Not these guys.

Speaker: Elena
Text: “On behalf of Lord Avery, I invite you to my manor at sundown tomorrow. The time has come to abandon our animosities… and reunite under the banner of God… and liberty.” Signed Thomas Tew.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What do you bet… Thomas Tew. Henry Avery. Looks like our hosts didn’t stick around to clean up heir mess.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well that wasn’t very gracious of them.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, so… So these guys sparked a full-scale revolt when they claimed the treasure for themselves. Now, they took care of the colonists, but then they had to deal with each other. And I’m guessing things got pretty messy. So, Avery and Tew invite them up here. To umm… Ah, what was it, uh-- ?

Speaker: Elena
Text: “Abandon our animosities.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: “Abandon the animosities.” Avery makes a grand toast…For God and liberty,” Argh, ahoy, mateys, all that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: And they all take a swing… Except these two. And just like that. All the treasure of Libertalia becomes the sole possession of two men. These are… These are… some of history’s greatest pirates… and they all perished… in an instant. At this very table.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s incredible.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. I’m -- I’m sorry. I uh. I’m sorry.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s okay. So, since our missing hosts aren’t here at Tew’s manor…

Speaker: Nate
Text: We should head over to Avery’s.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Let’s go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: There. For posterity. Hey, up here. Slowly.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Right behind you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, be careful. Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Aaahh!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m okay! I got it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’ll meet you up top!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hi.

Speaker: Nate
Text: More cannons. Just like at Tew’s mansion.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I guess the poison is mightier than the cannons.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: You know, ‘cause he ended up poisoning… Yeah, that was bad… Sorry.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yup, pretty bad. And we are officially inside Henry Avery’s house. Word of the day… “ostentatious.”

Speaker: Elena
Text: So why didn’t he kill Thomas Tew? Was he like his right hand man?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, that’s exactly what he was. Can you imagine taking orders from a paranoid psychopath?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, sounds like my first job.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What, the producer on your TV show?

Speaker: Elena
Text: No, my manager from Macho Nacho.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You worked t a Macho Nacho?

Speaker: Elena
Text: It was a high school job.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Did you wear one of those hats?

Speaker: Elena
Text: The point is… my boss was a paranoid psychopath.

Speaker: Nate
Text: He was the manager at a Macho Nacho.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just watch it, okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look. Shoreline barricaded the front door.

Speaker: Elena
Text: And left a bunch of muddy footprints behind.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s see where they went. Huh. Hello.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So, where are all the Shoreline guys?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know, right? I expected to see someone by now.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, it’s like they all up and vanished.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You don’t suppose there’re… pirate ghosts?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Don’t even joke about that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, here we go… Elena, check it out. Footprints go through this door. Crap, it’s blocked from the other side.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Why bother barricading their path, unless…

Speaker: Nate
Text: They found something. All right, help me push this open.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah… Oh shit! Shoreline.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap. Someone woke up cranky today.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Watch it! Sniper! Nate! It’s not over yet!

Speaker: Nate
Text: More coming!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, to your right!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Outta my personal space! Hey, good timing. Oh, crap.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh shit. Uh-oh.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Sniper!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus. You all right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah… they were just waiting to ambush us.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. All right, let’s get that door open. See what they didn’t want us to find. Okay, here we go. You ready?  Oh. Hello there. What is it?

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s a letter. Signed by… Avery.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really? Read it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: “My loyal subjects… As the sun sets on our glorious paradise, we must endeavor to preserve its riches… The traitorous Tew knows bur secrets, so we must act quickly. Destroy the dam, cleanse New Devon…”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Here we go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Uh-huh. “…and move my treasure through the passage to my ship.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: Tew and Avery turned on each other.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Are you really surprised?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well I guess not.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Here you go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks. Let’s go find that passage.

Speaker: Elena
Text: There’s no more footprints; they end here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, so… where did they go?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Pirate ghosts.

Speaker: Nate
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Let’s look around.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s Sam’s lighter.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Did he drop it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, on purpose. Whatever it is we’re looking for has to be somewhere around here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: There’s gotta be another way out of this room .

Speaker: Nate
Text: Maybe that passage Avery mentioned in the letter. But where’s the switch? Maybe this is a switch? No.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah… Did you find something?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I think so.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa. (laughs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s a good thing they figured that out for us.

Speaker: Nate
Text: How did you do that?

Speaker: Elena
Text: There’s a bloody fingerprint right here where Libertalia should be, and I… pushed it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nicely done.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So the letter said that Avery was moving his treasure to the Ship.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Do you think the treasure’s still on the island?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I think-- Uh… I think it doesn’t matter any more. Here we go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Careful, Nate. Hey, watch your head.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh. Looks like Avery built himself a panic cave.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, I wonder where this goes?  Crap.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Guess we’re gonna find out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: This place doesn’t look very stable.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look. Fresh footprints. They must’ve come this way.

Speaker: Elena
Text: That’s a lot of footprints. Let’s take this slow.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Crap…

Speaker: Elena
Text: What the hell was that--?

Speaker: Nate
Text: My money’s on Nadine’s men. They’ll use any excuse to use dynamite.

Speaker: Elena
Text: They’d have to be pretty dumb to use it in here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, they’re pretty dumb. Uh oh.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You bring any spare batteries?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, yeah. But, they’re at the bottom of the ocean.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I won’t ask.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I won’t tell. Whoa, whoa. Hold up.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So… some kind of deathtrap?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh… Yeah. But Sam and the others somehow made it across… We just gotta follow their lead.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wouldn’t be so bad if it didn’t creak so much.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just don’t go where the footsteps aren’t.

Speaker: Elena
Text: What?

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m just a little preoccupied with not blowing up right now. And… unclench. Woo. Elena, look. Footprints stop here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: They must’ve made it through and it collapsed behind them.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey. Just gonna move this out of the way, here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Damn it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: We’ll have to find another way. Oh no. Just hold out a little longer…! Crap. Come on. Damn it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey-- you still have Sam’s lighter?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yes! Good idea. C’mon. C’mon, c’mon, c’mon. Of course he used it all up. Smoked like a goddamn chimney on the boat ride over…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Relax, I brought some matches.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You did?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Of course. There we go.  Ow! Sorry. Just… one sec.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ow! Ow, that’s my head. Hello.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Over here!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ow, uh. I tripped.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Over here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Thanks. Glad you came prepared.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Somebody had to. C’mon, let’s find a way forward.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Nice romantic lighting, huh?

Speaker: Elena
Text: You have a funny idea of romantic.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yes I do. Hey, this looks promising. Boost you up?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon. Okay, here we go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay. Come up. Come on up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Thanks.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Watch your head.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Careful.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Elena
Text: What the hell is this…?

Speaker: Nate
Text: “The hands that stole from me.” Wow Avery’s not even pretending to be sane at this point.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I don’t like this place.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Me either. Let’s get out of here. Hey, look. Avery had some gibbets left over.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Gibbets.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s pronounced JIH-bets.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you sure?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well. No one likes a know-it-all.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Gibbets.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, is that… a mummy?  You okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I think so. What was that?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Trap. Avery really didn’t want any trespassers down here. All right, watch your step.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Me? You’re the one that stepped on it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Fine, watch my step. Ah, hell--!  Aagh!  God damn it!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Are you okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, so far so good… Maybe I’d just stay a little ways back. Oh crap. (explosion]

Speaker: Elena
Text: (coughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: You okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah… Well, now we know what caused the explosion we heard earlier.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, no wonder so many parts of this passage have caved in.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey Nate-- I found a shortcut.

Speaker: Nate
Text: How do you know it’s a shortcut?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Trying to be optimistic here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. All right. Jesus. Oh damn it. More mummies. Don’t explode, okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just… careful.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Agh! Jesus--! What did I just say?! Oh, for Christ’s sake--!   Oh, this can’t be healthy to breathe.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate! Are you okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Fine, I-- Fine. I wish I’d brought ear plugs. Am I yelling?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, careful.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. And Avery’s gone all Egyptian. Except this mummification wasn’t, you know, voluntary. Well… we’re back on the trail.

Speaker: Elena
Text: The footprints go this way.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Be ready for a fight.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, I always am.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, is that in reference to me?

Speaker: Elena
Text: No. Would you calm down?

Speaker: Nate
Text: You calm down. Eesh. Guess these guys weren’t paying attention. There’s no sign of Sam.

Speaker: Elena
Text: We’ll find him.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah! Elena, get down! You idiots trying to bring the whole place down?!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Got ‘em!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Woah… Jesus!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ah crap, shotgun!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh shit--! Elena, get behind something!   Well, for once, I appreciate Avery’s exploding mummies.

Speaker: Elena
Text: “The mouths that spoke ill of me.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’d hate to see this guy’s Christmas tree.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I don’t see any footprints. We must be on a different route than the others.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, let’s see if we can catch up. Why… hello.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey. So, I guess this loops around?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Guess so. Jesus. This was one of Avery’s guys.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Dead men tell no tales. Looks like a fight broke out.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, Tew’s men versus Avery’s. Excuse me. Hello…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Some kind of key. What’s that note?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, right. It’s uh… it’s from Tew to his men. We can use the key to get out of here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: That’s good.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hmm. There are some symbols on the back.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, let’s go find a keyhole.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh boy. Ah, crap--! Ah! I’m okay! You gonna explode now, huh? No? How ‘bout you?

Speaker: Elena
Text: This guy had some serious trust issues.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh God, oh god, oh god !  Okay, okay, you done?!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nice moves.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh. Not quite as creepy as all the hanging bones.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Still, it’s a little creepy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, maybe three out of ten though.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I’d say four.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really, four?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Mmm hmm. Oh, my ears just popped.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. We’re definitely descending.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay. It’s another deathtrap.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, no footprints to guide us. The symbols match the ones on those posts. Huh. Tew showed his men how to get past the traps. Okay, we’re off to a good start. Follow my lead, okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just be careful…

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m always careful.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Says the guy who set off every mummy bomb in this place.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, you know, not a lot of experience with the mummy bombs. Thank you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So far so good…

Speaker: Nate
Text: There! Made it! In your face, Avery. That’s our way out of here.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ah-- God, are those the rest of Tew’s men?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, gotta be. We know Avery likes to make an example of his enemies.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He definitely likes making exploding mummies.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Let’s, uh… tread carefully in here.  Keyhole… Key.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Wait… it could be a trap.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, we really don’t have much of a choice.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh boy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: But… I have a good feeling about this. Yeah?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Do it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Back up.  You see?  Well, at least we didn’t get blown to bits…  Ah, shit. You didn’t bang a knife by any chance, did you?
Action: (opens the door) (laughs) (they caught by a net) (mummies start exploding)

Speaker: Elena
Text: No… but that guy’s got a sword. Here, help me swing this thing.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… Damn it!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I got it!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate! (they run for their lifes]

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, c’mon, go, go!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh God--!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Don’t look back, just run!Don’t stop!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whoooooaaaa--!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aaahhhhhhh! Keep running! I’m right behind you!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, move your ass! Let’s go! C’mon! C’mon! Get up!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, yeah.  Thanks, Captain Avery.  Just like old times, huh? Elena? Hey. Elena, c’mon. Elena!

Speaker: Elena
Text: My… hero…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh no, you didn’t do that.

Speaker: Elena
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: No. That’s not funny.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh, you have done much worse.

Speaker: Nate
Text: God, you gave me a goddamn heart attack.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh… let me listen. Sounds good to me.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What--?  You realize… we are now even for everything I’ve ever pulled, all right? Yeah, like ever.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No. Not by a long shot.  Gosh, you’ve got mud everywhere.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Anyone ever tell you, you have a… idea of romantic?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Yeah, I may have heard that somewhere before. (they kiss]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Good talk.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Good talk.
[Far explosion.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s gonna be Sam. C’mon. At least the gunfire means he’s still alive… for now.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Is that… a galleon?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Sure looks like it. Holy crap. It’s a ship graveyard. Looks like we can get down this way.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, looks… safe.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: After him!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap. Look.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: We’ve got him pinned down, c’mon!

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s Sam.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He’s surrounded.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Don’t let him get away!

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon. We gotta go get him. I gotta find a way to the beach.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate! They’re behind you!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Find some cover! Go!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Sniper! Get down! Down!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh boy! Oh shit. Too close.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, watch out!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Seriously?!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Get back!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Whoa… geez. Ah, the bigger they are… the harder they are to take down! Elena! This way!  Now we’re talking!

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mon. We can cut through he ship’s hold.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, no, no, no! I love idle threats. Geronimo! You okay?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I’m okay enough. Now let’s find your brother.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, we can squeeze through here. Okay… now where did Sam go?

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: He went this way!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, there’s your answer.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh yeah? We’ll see about that. Whoa. That’s was close. Nate, up on the ship-- It’s Sam! Ah shit, he’s pinned down.

Speaker: Sam
Text: God damn it…! Fight fair, you bastards! Nathan, take cover! Oh, is that all you got?! Man, you’re a sight for sore eyes.
[All shoreliners successfully killed.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: How about we get off this damned beach, huh?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Absolutely. Did you, find my lighter? (explosion]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ahhh!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Shit. We’re sitting ducks in here!

Speaker: Elena
Text: We gotta take out that RPG!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Right.

Text: The cliffs! We can take cover there! I got one!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Rocket man is down!

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right, you got him!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Behind you, behind you!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Guy’s got an RPG! Nathan, move!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Got one! Yes.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m right behind you guys.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, c’mon!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ah damn it! Our friends are back!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Take those suckers out! Nathan! Take them out with your RPG!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. That’s right!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Over here! Follow me!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Go on.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay-- here.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s encouraging.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hurry!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Jesus!

Speaker: Sam
Text: We gotta move it!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hurry!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Aahhh!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate?!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m good, just run! Oh, no!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I gotta get out of here. Oh no. Oh, wonderful. Ah, Christ, how many of these trucks did you bring, Rafe? Ah, crap! Oh, thank God, it’s leaving… Wait, that Shoreline merc had an RPG… Where the hell is it? All right, truck. You’re going down. Ha ha! Gotcha! And thank you for the exit. Oh son of bitch, another one? Here we go. All right Nate, think… think. Stairs. The stairs. Yeah, that’s it. Just hide db here. Can’t get me up here, right? I’m sure it’ll be safe. Ah why? Why? Why?! These guys just don’t give up! Stop it, just stop it! Good thing for me, you’re a terrible driver. Whooooaaaaaa! Oh God--! Ah, man. Gotta move. Gotta move, gotta move… Gotta move! Just keep going. Shit! Sully?!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: How you doing, Nate?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look out! Throw me the RPG!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You got it!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Play time’s over.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Finish those bastards, will ya?

Speaker: Nate
Text: My pleasure! For God and liberty, asshole! Eh… that sounded better in my head.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nice work, kid.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, thanks for the assist.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: C’mon over. I’ll get you out of there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Please.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Good to see you, kid.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, right in the nick of time.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah, well… got a little antsy waiting around to hear from you two.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, no, we gotta find Sam and Elena still. ah, no, we gotta find Sam and Elena still.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Are you okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: We heard those explosions. We thought--

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, it’s all this guy.

Speaker: Elena
Text: You saved his ass again?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Naturally. How you doing?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Good. Good. There were some close calls, but um…  He covered me.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey. How’s that?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh.  Bullet grazed my shoulder.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: You?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Cliffside… grazed my face. So how’d you lose Rafe?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I led his crew right into one of Avery’s traps.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Smart.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, hey look… about the whole Alcazar thing--

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey just, we can save that for later, okay? Which way?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: On the beach, other side of this town.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Good. I hope all that ruckus didn’t attract any attention.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Sorry. What are we doing?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: What do you think we’re doing? We’re getting the hell off of this rock.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Right we-- we could do that… or we can head in that direction… which is a short cut.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Short cut do what?

Speaker: Sam
Text: To Avery’s treasure.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh, wow.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I mean, Rafe’s got to go all the way around but we could just--

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, screw Rafe!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, Victor with all due respect maybe just--

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You just don’t know when to quit.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Look, we’re all here for the same reason, right? Right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We didn’t come after the treasure, we came after you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: And I appreciate that. I do. But we’re good. And we’ve got the lead for now. We can do this. Nathan, .c’mon. Huh? Look around. Okay, Avery scuttled every last ship on this island. You know why?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Because he was hell-bent on keeping his treasure…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Exactly.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No matter the cost to the others around him.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Because he didn’t want anyone to follow him. Because he was leaving. Look at this. Okay. I found his map of the island. Okay? That’s his ship right under that mountain. That’s where our treasure is. And it is exactly where Rafe is heading right now… while we stand around here and argue like idiots.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Okay, what if he’s already left the island… and his ship sunk somewhere out there in the middle of the ocean?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Then we find out where it got sunk.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Oh, boy…

Speaker: Sam
Text: How long we been chasing this thing, huh? You and me. No offense to these guys… but they don’t get it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Actually Sam, they do. They really do.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Trust me, they’ve seen this… kind of obsession before.

Speaker: Sam
Text: (sighs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: But Sam… we’re not those kids anymore. We’re not. And we got nothing to prove.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Victor, where’s that plane?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Right this way.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Is it far?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Not very. Just through this port town.

Speaker: Elena
Text: What if Shoreline set up an ambush by the plane?

Speaker: Sam
Text: They didn’t.

Speaker: Elena
Text: And what makes you so sure?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Because they’re heading to the mountain. For the treasure.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: This way. There she is.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s a long drop. How did you get here?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I hopped down a few of these walls, but… I guess we’ll have to find another way around. What the hell was that?

Speaker: Elena
Text: That came from the mountain.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s Avery’s traps.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Hey, that means they’re blowing themselves up.

Speaker: Sam
Text: No, it means they’re on the right path.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey c’mon. Let’s just stay focused, huh?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, I jumped down from up there… but it’s too high to get back up.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Maybe there’s something we can put under it?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Give me a hand, Sam.

Speaker: Sam
Text: All right.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey, you need a hand?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, no thanks. We got it.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Anyone see a way out?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey guys. Through here. Whoa. Check that thing out.

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s like a skyrail or something.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Think it still works.

Speaker: Nate
Text: There’s no controls, but I bet I could pull the platform with my rope.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: The hell are you doing, kid?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh… Not sure yet.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Maybe if you could get to that wooden platform down there…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, we’re getting there.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I can’t wait to sleep in my own bed again.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: So close, yet so far…

Speaker: Sam
Text: I got an idea… Nathan, give me a hand?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Okay. Victor, Can I borrow you for a sec?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Sure.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Go ahead, Nathan. There. We’ll hold it down. You jump across.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Made it.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Here we come.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I got it! All right hop on and I’ll pull you across!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay, we’re ready!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Well, this is some impressive engineering for a bunch of pirates.

Speaker: Elena
Text: This is nothing. You shoulda seen the elevators.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Wait, they have elevators?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Whoa--!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hang on!

Speaker: Nate
Text: You guys all right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. It’s like a roller coaster.

Speaker: Sam
Text: C’mon up, Nathan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, shit!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Go! Jump off, quick!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nate, gimme your hand!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Whoooaaa!

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: There you go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Son of a bitch.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, c’mon!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Huh? All right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon, just jump, I’ll catch you. Let’s go. No. No, no, don’t even think about it, you hear me?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m sorry I got you into this. All of you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, all that doesn’t matter anymore okay? Just… just jump.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I gotta see this thing through, Nathan.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam. Hey, listen to me! If you do this, I’m not coming after you! You hear me?

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m sorry.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam! Sam! Stupid, stubborn…

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: He called your bluff.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He’s gonna get himself killed. C’mon.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, she’s-- she’s probably right.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Of course she is. Let’s go.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Up here. Maybe we can head him off.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m gonna save him… then I’m gonna punch him.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: All right, let’s just worry about the saving part first.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What the hell is he thinking? I mean, after everything we-- Wasn’t this enough?  Let’s just find him. Hey, we can get over that wall with this. C’mon.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Here, we got you.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You ready?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hold on. Got it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay… All right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, see?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: This isn’t gonna hold.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon…

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate, go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No-- I got it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, crap. C’mon…

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: God damn it. Now how the hell are we supposed to get up there?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We don’t have enough time.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Nate… No. Not by yourself.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look, I’ll come right back, okay?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Look, he is not gonna leave without a fight.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Then I’ll fight him if I have to. But either way I’m bringing him back. Just get the plane as close to the mountain as you can. And be ready for a quick getaway.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Like there’s another kind?

Speaker: Elena
Text: It’s not fair.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Huh?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Doing the dishes? We take turns. Don’t even think about not coming back.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I love you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Same to you, cowboy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay. Hey, what’s that? Footprints… Sam! Ah, God damn it. I’m sure he’s a ways off by now. Just gonna head to the creepy mountain, save Sam, get the hell outta here… Yeah. Be laughing about the whole thing tomorrow. Here we go. Back on the trail. The footprints end here. Oh, c’mon. Which way did he go? More footprints… Well, you didn’t fall to your death so… that’s good. I still get a chance to kill you. Ah! Jesus Christ. What’s this? Ha ha. More footprints. Well, in we go. Hey Sam? Whoa! Well, there you are. Okay… here we go… Whoa. Oh crap--! Agh -- whoa! Okay… Phew… Ahh! Ah, c’mon. Uh, whoah! All right. I can make it. I can do it. Oh, shit! Oh, oh, oh crap! Agh -- whoa!  I made it. I don’t know how I made it, but I made it. Oh my God, that’s Avery’s Ship. Whoo. All right. Oh shit-! That was too close. I guess this is my way down.  Oh God, come on! Whoaaaaaaa--! Did you really do all that, Sam? I doubt it. He probably found the dry way down. Less painful… way down.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: We almost done here?

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: This is the last of them, ma’am.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Good. If we hurry, we can catch up with the others.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Sam just stole our goddamn boat. He’s headed for Avery’s ship. Come on.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Let him. We’re done.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We’re done?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Most of my men are dead, Rafe. And those who aren’t have already left.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Can you see that? The end is literally in sight.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: That maniac pirate of yours has rigged this entire cave. I’m not setting foot on his ship.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nadine. If you cut and run right now, the loss of all your men -- everything that we’ve done -- is for nothing.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: We have millions in gold right here. I’d say that plus our lives is something.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: No wonder so many of your men abandoned you.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Excuse me?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: We’re on the verge… of making history here, and you’re willing to just walk off with a pittance a fraction of what Sam’s gonna get from that boat.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: If he can walk away from that ship alive… he can have it. Hell, I’d say he’s earned it. God knows you didn’t.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Now, look… We can stand here and insult each other all day… or we can finish what it is that we--

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Oh, we’re finishing it all right--

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Sorry, ma’am.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Yeah… Thing about mercenaries, Nadine… their loyalty, it’s bought… it’s not earned. Now, come on. Either we finish this thing together… or we can just end it right here.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Let’s go make history.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Atta girl. By all means.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Let’s see what you have in store for us, Captain Avery. Holy shit! Sam…
[Nate swims to Avery’s ship. It’s explodes and burning.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, Shoreline… Whoa-- crap! Sam?! Whoa. Look at that. There’s your treasure… God damn… Was it worth it?  Sam?  Sam?!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: (coughing]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Hey, Nate. (point his gun at him]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where is Sam? (upholster his gun too]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh, he’s right there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Relax, he’s alive. Y’know, this idiot nearly got us all killed.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m getting him outta here.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: No…. you’re not.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Rafe, you can have the treasure, all right? Just let me save my brother. (coughs]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: After everything he’s done…? How noble of you… but no.

Speaker: Nate
Text: We stay here any longer and we’re all dead. Is that what you want?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: That’s not what I said. What do you think, Nadine?   Good to see you up and about. Be a dear and relieve Nate there of his gun?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Hand it over.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You really think you can trust him? Huh?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Not your concern.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Now, why are you trying to instigate? Nate-- Nadine and I are partners… I don’t screw over my partners. Get over there. You and your brother, though… Right from the start, you took advantage of my generosity. You tried to cut me out and it’s high time you learned--
[Nadine points her gun at Rafe.]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: …What are you doing?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Now you give me your gun.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nadine…

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I won’t ask you again.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You are being… profoundly stupid right now.

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Look over there.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nadine, stop screwing around--  Jesus!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I said look!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Okay, it’s a couple of skeletons. So what?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: I don’t know as much about history as you boys… but I’ve got a pretty good idea who those two are.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Well, enlighten us.

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s Avery and Tew. They killed each other.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Good for them. What’s the point?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Everyone obsessed with this treasure… gets what they deserve.

Speaker: Nate
Text: So what, you’re just leaving us here to die?

Speaker: Nadine
Text: Oh, I’m just leaving. Whether you die or not, I don’t really care.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nadine… wait--!

Speaker: Nadine
Text: So long, Rafe.
[Leave and closes the door.]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nadine! Nadine! You open this goddamn door right now!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Rafe, she‘s gone! C’mon, give me a hand; w ‘ll all get out of here.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Oh, no… No, that won’t work.

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’ mon, help me with Sam and I’ll help you open the door.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: No, I’m not going to be able to enjoy… one of these coins… (picks up a sword]

Speaker: Nate
Text: God… damn it…

Speaker: Rafe
Text: …knowing that you and your worthless brother are still sucking air.

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right, just… just calm down. You can practice your fencing when we get outside.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: Nate. Just shut up.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Seriously, Rafe… this is insane, even for you.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You want to hear insane? “Nathan Drake raced a madman and his entire army to the steps of Shambhala.” (swings his sword]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, Jesus!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: “Nathan Drake found a lost city in the middle of the Rub’ al Khali desert.” (swings his sword]

Speaker: Nate
Text: God damn it--! Come on, we can get out of here together!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: “Nathan Drake discovered the fabled El Dorado…” (swings his sword twice]

Speaker: Nate
Text: C’mon Rafe, stop!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: “Nathan Drake is a legend.”  You know, I shoot the man who told me that.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Look I get it, you don’t like me very much.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You no , for all your “greatness,” Nate, you have nothing. You are naming. And I warned you to get out of my way.  I have sacrificed everything to find Avery. And I’m not gonna let a couple of two-bit thieves… a senile con man… and a washed-up journalist take that away from me!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Enough!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You care… about that parade of losers so much… I’m going to make sure they join you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: En garde , dickhead.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: That’s the spirit. Come on, Nate. Hold… still! C’mon, quit prolonging the inevitable. My arm’s getting tired. Now we’re getting somewhere.

Speaker: Nate
Text: The hell’s wrong with you?

Speaker: Rafe
Text: This… might hurt a little.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Get off!

Speaker: Rafe
Text: C’mon, “legend”. Yaaah! Come on, Nate. Come on! Yaaah! Now that’s the Nathan Drake I hear so much about. All right, all right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: We’re done here. I’m taking my brother and we’re leaving. You want to stay and burn with this ship, you be my guest.

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You got me. You know what, Nate? Underneath all the bravado you’re just a sad little boy… with delusions-- of grandeur… who, by the way, can’t fence for shit. So long, Nathan Drake.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan! (throws him a sword]

Speaker: Rafe
Text: You don’t know when to give up, do you? That’s good. Don’t hand it to me. I’ve had everything handed to me… on a goddamn silver platter. Everything except this! I earned this. All of it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You want the treasure, Rafe? It’s all yours.  Holy shit. Hey, c’mon. Let’s get you out of here. (trying to lift the plank]
Action: (cut the rope holding treasure and kills Rafe)

Speaker: Sam
Text: I’m trying… It’s too heavy.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just try again.

Speaker: Sam
Text: It’s no use.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Try again! Agh-- c’mon!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan--

Speaker: Nate
Text: God-- damn it!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Listen to me! Listen to me! All I ever wanted to do… was find this treasure with you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sam, no, shut up.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, we did It. We did it, little brother. Okay? It’s all right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, there’s gotta be another way--

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan. Nathan. You gotta go.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, no, there’s gotta be something--

Speaker: Sam
Text: You gotta go!

Speaker: Nate
Text: There’s something--

Speaker: Sam
Text: There is no other way! C’mon, Nathan. I gotta know you made it out all right!

Speaker: Nate
Text: No…

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, the whole place is about to blow up!

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s it. That’s it!

Speaker: Sam
Text: What the hell are you doing?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just trust me.

Speaker: Sam
Text: God damn it.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Just get your head down!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh shit. (blows the plank with a cannon]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Do it now. C’mon. Go! Go!  Alright--

Speaker: Sam
Text: You are one crazy son of a bitch.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Takes one to know one. C’mon.
[The swim out Avery’s ship.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: God--!

Speaker: Sam
Text: There! That’s our way out, Nathan. Come on!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Keep going!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Just a little further!

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’m with ya!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Nathan, look out!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, crap! We’re almost there! Sam, don’t stop! Don’t stop, c’mon!
[They manage to swim ashore.]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh. Holy shit. Oh, Nate! Nate! Hey! C’mon, I got you. Are you okay?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh! Hey! Hey Sully, I got ‘em.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Where are ya?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We’re right here.
[She fires a flare. Sully arrives and take them out of the island. Later, on the dock…]

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: So, you got everything?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, think so. But, feel free to sell anything I left behind. (chuckles]

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: You sure I can’t give you a lift home?

Speaker: Nate
Text: After the last few days, I think I’d like a plane with drink service and reclining seats. Plus, uh… she and I have a lot to talk about.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Yeah, you do. And no more late-night phone calls about “one last time,” hm?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Promise. Thanks, Sully.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Take care, kid. Don’t be a stranger.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Next time you’re in town… beers are on me.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: I’ll hold you to that.

Speaker: Sam
Text: And then the bunny… escapes anyway and it leaves little bunny surprises all over the headmaster’s bed. It was a dis--

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, what are you telling her?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just about your little “magic” phase.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, I hate you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: What was your stage name?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Go on, tell her.

Speaker: Nate
Text: “Nate the Great.”

Speaker: Sam
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s not funny. It makes sense.

Speaker: Sam
Text: In his defense he was actually you were pretty good.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Uh-huh.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey look, Sam, it ms been… an experience getting to meet you.

Speaker: Sam
Text: With a handshake?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well--

Speaker: Sam
Text: Bring it in for the real thing, sister. Hey, take care of this numbskull, all right?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, I will.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I’ll join ya in a sec.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I like her. God help her, she sure seems to love you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know, right? Listen, the offer still stands.

Speaker: Sam
Text: I appreciate it, but I’m good.

Speaker: Nate
Text: I know, but if you feel you’re imposing, you’re not, we talked about it--

Speaker: Sam
Text: it’s not about that, it’s not about that. It’s a little bit of that, okay, but…  Just, kind of… thought that after we found Avery’s treasure, I’d be… satisfied?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Instead, I’ve, ah… kinda left with this strange feeling of…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Emptiness.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well, you know, as thrilling as the next adventure might be, in the end… you re always left with that same thing. Sometimes you just gotta… choose what you’re gonna keep and… and what you’re gonna let go.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well… I guess I’m just not there yet. And besides, you know, you’ve got a few ancient cities on me. And I can’t let’s that slide, so…

Speaker: Nate
Text: I left a couple out there. Well, thank you.  Oh-- That’s, that’s our ride.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… Sam… We’ve come far.

Speaker: Sam
Text: We sure have, little brother. Come here. (hugs]

Speaker: Mate
Text: Listen, you don’t do anything I wouldn’t do, all right?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Get outta here. Vamoose. (Let’s go]
[Nate leaves.]

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Got a light?

Speaker: Sam
Text: So… Victor… what next for you, hm?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Mmm.  Well, before I got dragged into this… I was working on a business deal of sorts.

Speaker: Sam
Text: “Of sorts?” Hmm. Dangerous?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Ehh. With these people, yeah… It’s up there.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Well, I just so happen to know a certain someone -- recently out of prison -- who might be perfect for this kind of work.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Ooh… I don’t know. Is he trustworthy?

Speaker: Sam
Text: More or less.

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: How’s his Portuguese?

Speaker: Sam
Text: Um… Quando o seu marido volta para casa?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: What’s that mean?

Speaker: Sam
Text: How long before your husband gets home?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: That’ll do.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Hey, you got any more of those cigars?

Speaker: Sullivan
Text: Don’t push your luck.
[Next scene. Nate’s office at work. Jameson enters.]

Speaker: Jameson
Text: (sighs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, good morning.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Indeed it is, indeed it is…

Speaker: Nate
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Jameson
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah… All right, I’ll bite. What’s going on? Land a big contract or something?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Oh, even better… I’m on the verge of selling Jameson Marine.

Speaker: Nate
Text: No kidding…

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow, that… Well, hey, I guess-- I guess congratulations are in…

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Well, not yet… but I’m confident it’ll go through. They drove a hard bargain. But in the end I think we came to a… mutually beneficial agreement.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well that’s… that’s great.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you gonna stay on?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: No, no, no, I think I’d like to just relax… hang with the family… go fishing every chance I get. (chuckles]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Good for you  So who’s the sap who’s gonna buy this place?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Oh, uh, you are.  (throws him the key]

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? No, c’mon, seriously.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Oh yeah, seriously. (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wait, Jameson? Hey, wait! Wait up, man!

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hey! Morning, guys.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What are you doing here…?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Just thought I’d take you know… one final look.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Already gave your husband the keys.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Okay, uh, is this.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Perfect.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Is this for real?

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Nate… All you need to know is that you’d be making a very wise investment. Do the right thing here. Call me when you’re through?

Speaker: Elena
Text: You got it.  Hi.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hi. You’re-- you’re buying Jameson Marine?

Speaker: Elena
Text: We are buying Jameson Marine.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh. Okay. How? Why?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, I heart!r this rumor about a salvage job off the coast Malaysia and I thought it’d be right up our alley…

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, no… Honey, look… we barely got out of Libertalia alive.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, taking an illegal job? You know what that leads to.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Who said it was illegal?

Speaker: Nate
Text: (scoffs]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Look. This came in this morning. (hands him a piece of paper]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Is this legit.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Some of my old contacts out there-- they worked their magic with the Malaysian permit office. It was great. I didn’t even have to bribe anyone.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, that’s good, because I don’t know how we could possibly even afford to do this.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Here. Hold out your hand.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hold out your hand. C’mon. (hands him Avery’s coin]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Holy crap.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Where did you get this?

Speaker: Elena
Text: It was in my jacket pocket. Along with a bunch more.

Speaker: Nate
Text: A bunch? Sam.

Speaker: Elena
Text: He’s a sneaky one…

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: ‘Course, most of them are gonna have to go into our venture here. Along with all the new camera gear.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Camera gear?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. You know, I figured as we’re pulling all the cargo up from the dive… we could hire, you know, a small crew We could film the whole thing and resurrect my old show.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What happened to just… living a normal life?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I think in our attempt to lead a “normal” life, we may have… over steered. Look… Then I was on that island… I missed the adventure. I missed us. And so now we have a chance to do what we love. from here on out we are gonna operate on a strictly legal basis. All right. And I will be doing all of the shooting… with my really expensive camera.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Wow. You’ve really thought all this through, haven’t you?

Speaker: Elena
Text: More or less. But, listen just… say the word and I will call the whole thing off.

Speaker: Nate
Text: What? No, no, no, no, no. I don’t wanna be that guy who ruins Jameson’s early retirement like that. That’d be cruel.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Right…

Speaker: Nate
Text: It’s not gonna be easy, you know?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nothing worthwhile is. So… What do you say, Nathan Drake?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Sure, why not?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Hmm.

Speaker: Nate
Text: As long as I don’t have to do any paperwork.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, I can’t do it. I’m gonna have my hands full with the camera.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Well, I’m gonna have my hands full with all the diving.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Okay. Fine. We’ll take turns.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Or… I could play you for it.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Seriously?

Speaker: Nate
Text: No, listen, I have been practicing… I’m getting good.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No.
[The camera flies to the horizon.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: My hand eye is way better than it used to be.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I could-- you’re-- (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Really.

Speaker: Elena
Text: I cannot do that to you again.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Are you afraid to play me?

Speaker: Elena
Text: I am so not afraid to play you.

Speaker: Nate
Text: On a scale from one to ten, how scared are you to play me?

Speaker: Elena
Text: Like a three.
[The screen fades to black.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, well, jack that up to like, eleven, all right--

Speaker: Elena
Text: Ele-- (chuckles]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Because I’m coming for you.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh yeah?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. (chicken clucking]

Speaker: Elena
Text: Oh my… that’s… Okay. Fine.

Text: Where are they?

Text: Hmph. Oldschool.

Text: So good. I really sham clean this up.

Text: Let’s see that you got. Mom has weird taste in music. But I kinda like this tine.

Text: Whoa, so cool. I need to ask mom to borrow this one again.

Speaker: Girl
Text: I think they abandoned us.

Speaker: Girl
Text: All right… But just this one.  All right…  But this is the last one for today. Okay?

Text: Look at these two.  Here we go.  Hey!  Off she goes.
Action: (looks at photo) (chuckles) (takes an apple) (the dog runs away) (scoffs)

Text: [The girl goes outside.]

Speaker: Girl
Text: Perfect day. Now all we need is the rest of our boat crew. Anyone? No? Nothing? Okay. Hey, Vicky. Well, the food’s all here. Okay, girl. Where’s mom and dad? All right, go find them. Go.  Really? Fine, I’ll find them myself.
[She enters nearby house.]

Speaker: Girl
Text: And not here either. Okay, well… guess I just wait, then.  Whoa.… Good job cleaning this up.  You figured it out.  Oh yeah, I was hanging out with Sully for this one.  I remember that one.  Oh, this was definitely my favorite dig.  Look at you all bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.  Got the search area narrowed down quite a bit.     So goofy. He left his keys. He left his keys! There’s no way. There’s just no… way.
Action: (looks at some artifact) (looks at some note with a puzzle) (looks at newspaper clip) (laughs) (looks at another newspaper clip) (laughs) (looks at a map) (looks at photo of Sully and Elena hanging out) (sighs) (looks at a magazine with her photo) (chuckles)

Text: [She opens the cabinet, which, apparently, is usually closed. She is looking at items from previous Uncharted games.]

Speaker: Girl
Text: Who what is this? Pirate coin. Kinda looks like Avery’s sigil? Wait… is it Avery’s sigil? A Spanish doubloon. But from where? Sixteenth century. Where is this from? Kinda creepy… Kinda cool. Whoa, nice… uh… gun holster, Dad?  Hello. Wow. Oh my god… Whoa… Henry Avery… the Gunsway heist… Wait, did you go looking for Avery’s treasure? No way… Is that dad? Is that dad? Sic Parvis Magna… Greatness from small beginnings… Hm, what’s this…? (sees Nate’s photo with gun and treasures) What the hell? Oh shit.
[She hears footsteps and quickly closes the cabinet.]

Speaker: Girl
Text: Crap.
[Nathan Drake enters the house.]

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey -- there you are.

Speaker: Girl
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Nate
Text: Been looking for you. What are you doing in here?

Speaker: Girl
Text: Uh… looking for you guys.

Speaker: Elena
Text: C’mon. We loaded up the boat, it’s ready.

Speaker: Girl
Text: Cool, I’ll catch up with you guys in a sec.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Why?

Speaker: Girl
Text: Uh… I just need to… um…

Speaker: Nate
Text: What’s up, Cassie?

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Okay… Don’t be mad.  Hey, I said don’t be mad.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Keys. So… What did you see?

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Nothing really… Well, just that photo of you two and Sully. With a bunch of Spanish looking treasure. And a shotgun.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh.

Speaker: Elena
Text: This was bound to happen sometime. Maybe could just tell her.

Speaker: Nate
Text: She’s not ready for it…

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Ready for what? All the crazy shit in there.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Hey, language.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. Language.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Sorry. But you guys are literally keeping skeletons in your closet. Or at least a… a silver skull of some kind!

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know, I don’t think I’m ready for this… Really.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Nate… it’s time to have the talk.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Yeah! It’s totally time. Wait, which talk are we talking about here?

Speaker: Nate
Text: She’s just a kid.

Speaker: Elena
Text: She’s older than you and Sam when you started all of this.

Speaker: Nate
Text: That’s-- that is different. And you know it.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Okay look, if guys you were into some shady stuff it’s totally cool… but I think I’m old enough to know about its. Right?

Speaker: Nate
Text: “Old enough.” How old are you again?

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Hahaha. Funny. Mom?

Speaker: Nate
Text: All right.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Well, let’s see… umm… For me it started with this guy called me up with a scoop on “a massive historical find.” Sounded like a complete fraud.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah. Handsome fraud.

Speaker: Elena
Text: No, I hadn’t even met him yet.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, she knew.

Speaker: Elena
Text: (laughs]

Speaker: Nate
Text: She knew.

Speaker: Elena
Text: So this fraud says, “If you fund the trip… then I’ll give you the coffin of Sir Francis Drake.”

Speaker: Nate
Text: And for the record, I totally delivered.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah. You delivered us into the hands of Indonesian pirates.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Oh, come on. You know I had nothing to with that.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Okay, guys… time out. You’re saying that you were attacked by pirates… after you found the coffin of Sir Francis Drake. Is that right.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, pretty much, yeah.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Yeah, that-- that’s right.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Bullshit.

Speaker: Elena
Text: Language.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Language.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Crap.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Better.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: All right, so keep going.

Speaker: Nate
Text: You know what? The sun is up. Boat’s ready. Wind is just right. You wanna continue the story? I say we do it on the water. C’mon.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: Well, wait. What-- what’d Francis Drake look like? Was it gross?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Actually, he wasn’t in there. Yeah. Just his journal, with a map to El Dorado.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: The city of gold.

Speaker: Nate
Text: Ah, that’s the legend. Turns out it was just a statue. A cursed statue.

Speaker: Cassie
Text: No way. Seriously?

Speaker: Nate
Text: Yeah, seriously. But I’ll get back to that later… See, the map led us to the middle of the Amazon jungle…
